Gina reserved a room at a great lodge for her anniversary. She and her husband relaxed and ate great food. They hiked in the nearby mountains. It was a great, quiet retreat. Gina decided they would make it an annual trip.
I was riding a bus to a small village in Ukraine. An older man sat next to me. He kept talking to me, but I didn't understand him. He also kept offering me gum. I think he was drunk.
Jax started dating Carmen. However, Jax met a new girl Tiffany in Vegas. Jax started dating Tiffany as well. Jax decided he liked Tiffany more. So Jax broke up with Carmen.

Bray's granddad had had a stroke. Bray went to see him in the hospital. He feared his granddad would be enfeebled and ill. But then he saw that his granddad was still his old self, just weaker. Bray was relieved that his granddad was okay.
Zeke wanted to learn parkour. He joined the local parkour club. He practiced hard. Eventually, he became the teacher at the club. Zeke was finally good at parkour!

Jimmy arrived to the ocean with his fishing equipment. He took out his fishing rod and walked towards the dock. Unfortunately, one of the wooden boards from the dock broke. He ended up falling in the water. Another fisher managed to get him out of the water.

Megan went to the mall and saw a beautiful dress in a shopping window. She wanted the dress badly, but could not afford it. Megan decided to get a job and save up for the dress. After lots of hard work, she eventually saved up enough money. Megan finally bought the dress and learned the value of hard work.
Guillermo had bought a lottery ticket. He did not expect to win. He had never won before. So he watched the news for the numbers. And appeared that he had won.

Renee's best friend was moving away to college. The two of them had promised to hang out all the time still. Renee's best friend ended up hardly ever being able to hang out. Renee was super upset to be ditched by her friend so often. Renee eventually made new friends.

Sam had just seen a movie about panning for gold. His mom said there was no gold in their backyard creek. But Sam insisted, and she let him go out with the strainer. After a whole day of panning for gold, Sam conceded defeat. He admitted his mom was right - their creek had no gold!

Aaron met a Mexican girl and they fell in love. She told him she could make him rich by selling weed. She showed him a secret route across the US - Mexican border. He bought five pounds of weed for seven hundred dollars. On the way back he was stopped by police and charged with a crime.

Billy wanted to buy a new car for himself. He eyed all kinds of models. They were all too expensive! He saved up all summer long until he could afford one. By the time school started Billy arrived in his new car!
Tyler is skating. Tyler is showing off. Tyler falls and lands on his neck. He is taken to the hospital. Tyler has a broken neck and needs time to heal.

Kim took her kids to watch a movie. She didn't realize it would be so violent. Things got too out of hand midway. Kim had to take her kids out of the theater. They were upset but she stuck by her decision.

Laura meets a girl at a party who plays guitar. Laura likes the girl and wants to impress her. She goes home and tries to learn to play the guitar herself. It's hard to learn to play music without any help. Laura calls the girl and asks her to be a tutor.

In South Africa, every day I would walk to the store for food. I always passed by an old man in a wheelchair. I wanted to pray for him but could never convince myself. Finally it came to the end of my time in South Africa. The day I left I mustered up the courage to finally pray.

Adam was deemed too old for St Jude. However, they decided to take him in anyway. The cancer had already spread all over his body. He received many treatments over the course of a year. He died for a staph infection obtained after surgery.

Kat was excited for Christmas. In the weeks before the holiday, she decorated her house. She shopped for gifts for her loved ones. Kat celebrated Christmas with her family and friends. Kat had a fun and festive holiday.
Elizabeth was out for a stroll. She found a beautiful bridge. She decided to cross it. She walked across and looked at the beautiful water below her. This bridge was peaceful and beautiful.

The Jones family decided to take a road trip this year for Christmas. Their first stop was in Georgia to see their uncle Frank. They stayed with him for a day before moving on to Tennessee. There, they saw their grandma and grandpa. They finished the trip in Virginia before heading home.

My wife brought the car in for service today. The car needed an axle seal, as a previous mechanic indicated. That  mechanic did not replace seals. She went to another mechanic who ordered the part. The seal will be replaced tomorrow.

Amy stayed out all night with her best friend at the bar. She felt horrible when she woke up the next day. She called into work saying she was sick. Her boss understood. Amy didn't feel guilty and had a nice day off.

Chris woke up early on Saturday morning. He decided to go for a stroll. Passing by a cafe he heard loud commotion. He looked over his shoulder and saw a large crowd. The large crowd was holding Peace posters.

Jane stole a twenty dollar bill from her mom's purse. Jane's mom looked everywhere for the twenty dollars, not finding it. Jane's mom finally asked Jane if she had seen the money. Jane began to feel badly about what she had done. Jane came clean and confessed the theft to her mom.

Mia has 3 dogs that always want to sleep with her. Mia only has an air mattress and doesn't want the dogs on it. Mia makes sure to keep the dogs from her room. Mia forgot to shut her door and the dogs jumped on her bed. The dogs had sharp nails and popped Mia's air mattress.
She still ate fast food. She made choices that had low calories. She picked a kid's meal most of the time. She ate half and gave the rest to the dog. She started feeling very weak.
The man ordered the beer. The beer tasted flat. He asked the waiter for a different beer. The waiter charged him for the flat beer. The man complained to management.

It was Adam's first time driving a tow truck for a recovery agency. Adam had to pick up a car for recovery. Adam hooked up to the car he was supposed too. A lady came and yelled at Adam for taking her car. Adam drove away quickly with the car.
A new neighbor moved in. His name was Terri. He was an undercover cop. He blew his cover. The neighbors house was shot at.

Jervis decides he wants to eat more fish. He goes to the fishmonger to buy a nice bass. He buys the bass and cooks it at home. Jervis likes the fish he cooked. He feels happy that he is eating more fish.

Flying from Las Vegas to Austin or Dallas is unusually cheap. Rarely do I have to pay over $40 for a one way trip. My first time doing it, I was shown how to find flights online. I paid for my first flight on my cell phone in minutes! I was on a plane to another state within a week for $21.

Oscar and Frank accidentally broke their mother's favorite lamp. They talked about it agreeing to blame the parrot. When their mother walked into the living room the parrot spoke up. He told their mother about their plan. They tried to deny it but she knew the parrot never lied.

Sarah was looking forward to going shopping this afternoon. She got in her car and drove to her favorite shopping center. When she got to her favorite store, she could not find her wallet. She was panicked. She got in her car and was relieved to find her wallet had fallen out.
A band had just toured. The lead singer got sick. The bandmates didn't know what to do. The singer tried to get better. They just kicked him out.
Tom wanted to travel. Traveling was Tom's favorite activity. Tom visited a remote island. Tom saw apes. Tom fed the apes bananas.

Tracy was a big fan of soccer. She traveled to Europe for work last year. She really wanted to watch a soccer match. She decided to go to a game during her trip. She got fired because she went to the match instead of work.

Barry is out shopping at the store. While in the store he notices and old lady drop all her things. He walks over to the older lady. He helps pick up all the things she dropped. The old woman thanked Barry for the nice gesture.

I've always been shy, and I could never bring myself to be social. I'd shake in fear as I'd approach a new group of people I didn't know. But one day, I was finally sick and tired of being so unhappy. I approached them, and began to conversate and they all liked me. Sometimes you have to scatter your seed in order for things to grow.

Mary was walking through the park one day. She spotted a small yellow object next to a tree. She was surprised when she saw it was a baby duck! She decided to leave it alone and start walking home. As she walked, the duck followed her, all the way home.

Angela used to work for an insurance office but the office closed. The owner of the insurance office died of pancreatic cancer. Angela had to look for a new job. Looking for a job wasn't as easy as it had been when she was younger. No matter how hard she tried she couldn't get an interview.
She knew she needed to go to the hospital. She grabbed her keys and a bag. She put a towel down in the seat. She leaked on it all the way there. She was starting to go into labor.

Malcolm had an exceptionally high IQ. He made fun of other students in a display of his intellect. The other students got angry with him and beat him up. Malcolm wished he had been born stupid. The next day he decided to keep his smart mouth shut.

Peter was working on house repairs. He had just painted one of the rooms in his house. Peter walked back to look at the room. He stepped back into one of the walls he had painted. Peter got paint all over the back of his shirt.

Steve dared his friend Dave to jump into a very dirty river. Dave didn't want Steve to think he was a wimp. Right away he jumped right in. Later he found he'd contracted a bad illness from the dirty water. Dave regretted caring so much about what people thought of him.

Sherman and his friends were lighting off fireworks. Sherman got out a big mortar that was illegal in his state. He didn't have a pipe to put it in so he  dug a hole in the ground. When the mortar went off it traveled about five feet into the air. Sherman was blind afterwards and had to get extensive surgery.

I needed to work out a small amount. I decided to jog around the block a few times. I went outside to go jogging. I went around the block once and ran out of energy. I decided to just walk the rest of the way.

Khalid has been practicing his jump shot every day. He really wants to make a difference for his team. They had a game last Saturday and the scores were very close. Right before the buzzer, Kalid made a shot and it went in! He won the game for his team and realized all his hard work paid off.

Charles hated job hunting during the Christmas season. He found it impossible to find a job during that time. He sent his mom an e-mail asking to come home and then his phone rang. It was December 18 and a company wanted to interview him. They hired Charles and he worked a whole week before Christmas break.
My friend won tickets to a concert. She offered me the extra ticket. I gladly accepted it. We got there late because of traffic. We still had a great time.

The team refused to practice. The coach tried to change their mind. The team ignored the coach. They played a game on Saturday. They lost the game horribly.

Bobby's dad savored a cup of coffee every morning. Bobby thought it must be delicious. He was very excited when his dad finally let him try some. As soon as he got it in his mouth he spit it out. He didn't understand how his father could drink the horrible stuff.
Carla has always wanted to have a baby boy. Finally she becomes pregnant with a son. Carla prepares a bedroom for her new son. Finally her son is born. Carla is proud to have a baby boy.

Jerod took his girlfriend to Disneyland. They wore matching shirts. Everyone kept stopping them to comment on their shirts. They sent me a picture of them looking at Cinderella's Castle. Their shirts were of Beauty and The Beast.

Gina backed her car down the icy hill. She went back till the hill leveled out then sped up. She wasn't sure if she should stop at the top of the hill. But a car was approaching so she stopped. And was stuck once again.

Lacey noticed a cat and a dog in front of the house. They were calm at first. However, they started to jump on each other. To avoid getting into the fight, Lacey was standing in the parking lot She was able to go inside her house one the pets were gone.
The family drove up the mountain. Everybody's ears started popping. One of the kids thought it hurt. The mom told them chewing gum would help. They all chewed a piece of gum.

Danny was a mechanic and worked on cars full time. He was also very forgetful and had a tendency to misplace things. One day he reached for his wrench but it wasn't where he left it. He searched his entire garage from top to bottom with no luck. Tired, Danny sat down and was surprised to find it in his back pocket.
After work everyone was arm wrestling. Sean had the biggest arms and was beating everyone. Sally said she could beat Sean. Everyone began to laugh. Sally and Sean arm wrestled and Sally won.
Tom was had a bad tooth ache. He couldn't see the dentist in a few days. He tried taking some pain pills. It wasn't enough to help. He wound up taking more and overdosing.
Last week my parents went grocery shopping. The generic cereal was on sale. They couldn't pass up the good deal. It tasted terrible. We now realize why it was so cheap.
Cindy was given a glass angel for Christmas. She sets it out every year. It is her favorite piece. This year her dog knocked it over and shattered it. Cindy has never been so devastated.
Yesterday I had a rather lazy day. I laid in bed watching the kardashians. While I was watching I made hot chocolate. The day was very relaxing. I cannot wait to have another lazy Saturday.
The radio announced a bad storm. Anna was afraid. She shuttered her windows and huddled in her room. The storm was bad, but brief. Soon it was over, and the sun returned!

Martha is never at home to cook meals so she eats fast food a lot. Recently she realized she was gaining a lot of weight. Martha wanted to lose weight, so she signed up for food delivery. A company delivers a box of fresh ingredients to her door every week. Now Martha cooks her own meals and she's finally losing weight.

Maddie was mad that she had a test today. Although she studied, she was still very nervous. As soon as she walked into the room however, she was shocked. There was a substitute teacher. Maddie was then free from a test.

When we were camping on time we noticed some visitors. While we were in our camper we heard some noises. It was the sound of racoons going through our food we left out. They were adorable but we didn't want to get near them. We now know to hide our food.

I came home from school. After bathing and putting away my belongings, I had dinner. Since the night was almost over, I didn't have much time to study. I fell asleep on my couch after an hour. During the next day, I struggled on the Chemistry exam.

Betty liked candy. She like most flavors except for sour things. She got a bunch of sour candies from Santa yesterday. She has been pouty all day because of it. She ended up giving her candy to her brother.

Lisa regularly went to a restaurant after work and ordered a salad. She thought it was healthy. But she looked at its nutritional information online later on. It had too much fat, sugar, and calories. But the salad was so good that she continued to order it.

Timmy was excited for show and tell today. He had prepared all week. He woke up early and dressed up. He didn't realize there would be a school shooting that day. He never got to give his presentation.

Ben was working on a roof. He accidentally stepped on a long nail. The nail went through his shoe and into his foot. Ben was in so much pain! He had to leave work to go get the nail removed right away.
Johnny decided he wanted to dress up. He put on a suit. Johnny felt great. His friends told him he looked great. Johnny was glad he had dressed up.

I really had to go to the bathroom. So I told my cousins I would meet up with them after. I walked to the bathroom near the ferry. It was a mile walk. By the time I came back I was ready to pass out I was so tired.

Candy worked for the newspaper. She was editor of the classifieds. She had to sell ads to local businesses. As the began to sell, she started making new contacts. Candy loved her job and networking abilities.
Jim's wife really wanted strawberries. Jim was very forgetful. He didn't forget this time, though. Unfortunately the store had run out. Jim's wife thought he was just making an excuse.

Smoking for years had left him with a terrible chronic cough. He woke up this morning coughing very hard. He could barely breathe as he sat upright. He said he needed to stop smoking soon. I agreed with him and offered to start buying e-cigs.

Joe was a perfectionist. So he could never relax. While sitting down, it never felt like he was in the right position. And items in his room never seemed to be in the right place. Joe was left with little time to do anything important.

Sam was driving his friends around. One friend didn't want to put on his seat belt. Sam insisted that he should. The friend kept refusing until Sam slammed on the breaks. Sam's friend was upset but obliged.

Sarah joined a new singles club in her town. Sarah met Thomas there and they agreed to have dinner next Friday. Sarah bought a new dress and shoes. Sarah and Thomas had a great time together that night. They became engaged six months later.

One of my friends was really depressed. She kept bringing up sad situations. My friends and I sat down to talk with her. She was sad that she had no money. So we all decided to donate one hundred dollars to her.

My friend's wife got laid off two months ago. They gave her severance pay until November. She was going to retire on Social Security afterward. My friend said his wife has been bored lately. She is now looking for work.

Yesterday was my birthday. My friends all threw me a surprise party. When I showed up at my house all my friends were there with cake. It was so awesome to be surprised like that. The even got me some presents too.
Anna went to visit her husband in jail. The warden stopped her. He made her remove her shoes and jewelry. Then he let Anna in to see her husband. Anna was so glad to see him, she cried.

Bobby was picked on for being the smallest boy in his class. One day, Bobby decided to get big and strong. After school each day, he would go home and do fifty push-ups. For dinner, Bobby would eat lots of vegetables and meat. After all his hard work, Bobby became the strongest boy in school!

I went to the animal shelter in my town. I was sad to see so many pets without a home. I offered to foster one of the dogs until he found a forever home. The dog learned manners and loved being part of a family! In just a few weeks he found a loving family of his own.
Peter loved fairy tales. He wished he could be part of one. One day he got his wish. He met a beautiful woman. She made him as happy as could be.
My girlfriend went into the kitchen to make an apple pie. Soon she had put the pie into the oven. I smelled smoke. I went into the kitchen and saw the smoke. Her apple pie had burned inside the oven!

Max had learned to be courteous from his grandma. So when he took women on dates, he was always the best. Women always asked him how he turned out like he did. And he loved talking about his grandma saying how she taught him. The problem was he never stopped and the women left.

Gina had been waiting to see Jamie all day. When she did, he didn't seem to see her. She thought they had a connection, and would be more friendly. But it was just another day where she was invisible. Gina hung her head and let out a deep sigh.

Timothy was knew in town. He needed a little extra cash in his pocket. He went to a popular corner in the city. He started playing his guitar there. Timothy was very good and the people loved his music.

Jen wrote a story for her English class. She was finished and needed a title. She wrote down a list of 10 good potential titles. She crossed off the ones that weren't as good. Jen picked at random at the remaining 4 choices.

Phoebe was craving bananas. Phoebe got in her Honda Civic, and went to the grocery store. As she made her way through the produce section, she spotted a dog. Phoebe was confused by the loose dog in the store. Phoebe told the manager, and he quickly found the dog's owner.
Tom always had to share his food. He always had to give his brother half. Tom was mad at this. One day at school Tom forgot his lunch. He was happy when his brother shared half his lunch.

My family and I drove to Rutgers to watch their football game. We tailgated in the parking lot for a couple hours. Following the tailgate, we went into the stadium. Rutgers played horribly and lost the game by a lot of points. Even though they lost, we had a great time!

Steven always drank from water bottles at work. One day a coworker calculated how many bottles Steven was using. The number for each year was staggeringly huge---nearly a thousand. The co worker gave Steven a reusable water bottle for his birthday. Steven obligingly began using the reusable bottle.

Hannah started to type her research paper. Since it was a rough draft, she didn't correct her grammar errors. After an hour, she managed to type 500-600 words. Her mom caught her sleeping in front of her laptop. Since she didn't have time to revise the paper, she kept the draft.
Tom was out all weekend partying. He figured he didn't have much to do in class on Monday. He was hungover for his first class. It was math and his professor did a pop quiz. Tom did terrible on it.

Alice loved to ice skate. She hadn't been skating long, but it was a passion of hers. Tricks and jumps were just becoming part of her repertoire. After a few weeks of practice, she landed her first jump. It was a proud day.

The one time we went bowling with my sister. We were paying by the hour, so we were trying to bowl fast. I went up real quick and rolled the ball off my ankle. I couldn't believe how dumb I was. My sister will never let me forget that.
Kelly slept through her alarm. She woke up twenty minutes late. She had to rush through her morning routine. Then she sped through traffic. Luckily, she made it to work on time!

Sam is a 6 year old boy who lives with me. He was abandoned by his mother, who is my cousin. Last week she signed temporary custody over to me. I have been treating him like my son ever since. He has been playing and having a lot of fun at my house.
Ed wanted to do well on his road test. He studied the manual carefully. He did well on his written test! Then he had his driving test. He passed the test with flying colors!

I was moving into my dorm room across the state. We all took a roadtrip to it with my stuff. It was a long drive so everyone took turns driving. When we were close I navigated my parents to the dorm. After we made it there everyone helped me unpack and they left!

Lynn and I met at a Chinese restaurant for lunch. She told me she wasn't going to have lunch, though. She had finally found a weight loss center that was effective. Lynn had already lost 15 pounds in three weeks, and she was happy. So we enjoyed our conversation even though I was the only one eating.

Lynn had to move recently into an apartment. Before she moved she had put her stuff in storage. Unfortunately the stuff she needed was buried in the storage unit. So instead she went to the store and bought the stuff she needed. Lynn got many nice new kitchen items as a result.
Jane had never been on a boat before. She was nervous and scared. Luckily the water was steady. The trip was calm and easy. Jane got over her fear of boats.

Jill's family lived all over the USA. Jill invited most of her family for dinner on Thanksgiving. When they started arriving, Jill had second thoughts. Having all different kinds of people in her house was hard to manage. Jill managed to remain calm and survive the holiday.
Janice was going on a trip. She had booked a train ride from Chicago to LA. Janice loved to ride on trains. The trip was incredible. Janice loved every minute of it.

The stranger walked into town with a hatchet on his belt. He walked straight to the central bank. The man said nothing as he walked to a teller. The bank teller asked for his account information. The stranger slammed his hatchet on the table in response.
Graham got money for his birthday. He wanted a new toy. His mom took him to Target. There, he scanned the aisles. Finally, he chose a video game.

Elle strolled through the cycle shop, exasperated. She had no idea which bicycle to buy her husband for Christmas. She asked the store clerk which bicycle would be a good fit. The clerk recommended a silver bike with ten different speeds. Elle smiled as she told the clerk she would buy it.

In the middle of the night, the baby started crying. Secretly, Daddy hoped that Mommy would get up to comfort their child. Mommy shoved Daddy out of bed. Reluctantly, Daddy walked to the baby's room. Daddy rocked the baby back to sleep.

My friends and I wanted to go swimming. We went to the lake and put on swimming trunks. We hopped into the lake water. We swam for hours and jumped off the dock. We put our dry clothes back on and went home.
Carlos was on his way to see his brother. But first he needed to put air in his tires. So Carlos went to his nearest gas station. He put air in his car. Then he drove to his brothers house.

I recently visited my cousin's famous mansion. We went inside and took the tour. Everything was very 1970s, and just the way I remembered it. I told my son about my visits there as a small child. He was very impressed that I knew the King.

When my dad found out about Kevin, he invited him over. Kevin had been a friend of my brother's for years. When he got there, my dad told him we would never date each other. Kevin said it was like a punch in the gut. Later, he said he knew I didn't love him and was too young.
Jane wanted to go to Coney Island to have a hotdog. She worked hard all week. Finally on the weekend Jane was ready to go. She took the bus to Coney Island. When she got there she had a great hotdog.

Priss really wanted a string bikini for the upcoming vacation. All her classmate had string bikinis. Priss' dad gave her $30 and gave her discretionary power to spend it. Priss bought a string bikini at the mall. She wore the bikini during the vacation.

Gina's friend Tami wanted to sit with girls who didn't like Gina. Tami was the only friend Gina had left. So she decided to sit with Tami at the table with those girls. But it was a mistake. Gina ate silently since she was unable to join the conversation.

Rob needed to bake a cake for someone's birthday. But it was too hot to turn on his oven. So he planned to bake the cake late at night. But he had trouble staying awake. When he woke up, he realized he never baked the cake.
It was that time of year again. We had to put the Christmas tree up. Both of us were excited. We put all the ornaments on. It looked amazing.

Jen lost the use of her legs five years ago. When the doctors told her she could still walk, she didn't believe it. She skulked in her apartment all week. Until one day, the fire alarm went on. Without realizing it, she stood up and ran to the door.

Ever since I was young I dreamed of owning my own place. So, I got a job and saved up lots of money. Finally I started looking for an apartment. I called around and visited a few places. Eventually I found one that I liked and I got approved to live there.

Terry was excited to be going to watch a TV show live. Her husband didn't tell her which one. When they got to the set of The Price Is Right she nearly fainted. Even better, she was called to come on down. She was even happier driving home in her new car.

I loved the television show Gumby when I was a kid. I saw the Gumby figurines at the store. I bought them for my son. My son loved the Gumby figurines. I was able to share a special childhood moment with my son.

Max woke up and noticed he was late for work. He jumped out of bed and got dressed. Then, he quickly rode his bike to work. When he got there, he apologized to his boss. His boss forgave him and gave him one more chance.
I went to the airport yesterday. As I was hungry, I looked for food. I stopped at a bagel place. To my dismay, the bagel was five dollars. I could not believe the obscene price.

Ferdinand had a talent no one could deny. He was the best barista in the whole town. People would line up and wait hours for his creations. Everyone wanted the Ferdinand touch. He was proud, but hard working always pushing himself.

The pastor droned on with his Sunday morning sermon. The sermon failed to excite or interest the congregation. Many were checking the time or were looking at their phones. The pastor continued to preach for the next hour. Everyone was too polite to get up and leave.
Donna was exhausted. She'd had a horrible time sleeping lately. The street light shined in her room and kept her awake. She bought a sleep mask and put it over her eyes. She could finally rest!

Yesterday was a very long and tiring day. When I got home I wanted nothing more than a hot shower. As soon as I got out I collapsed on my comfortable bed. I fell straight to sleep within minutes of laying down. Suddenly at 3:00am I simply woke right up and couldn't sleep again.

The young married couple bought five acres on the outskirts of town. The woman has always wanted chickens. The man built a chicken coop and fenced an area. Grandpa asked if they had any gravel. They did not know that chickens need to eat gravel.

Jeff had been a hard worker at his office for a while. He was a very good worker. He was up for a promotion. Jeff waited nervously after his interview. His boss comes out to him to congratulate him on his promotion.
Tim was going into work. There was a big crowd and officials outside. Tim found out someone committed suicide. They jumped out of a window. Tim and his co-workers were given half a day off.

It was Emma's first day of kindergarten. She was excited to start school. Emma was also nervous that she would not know what to do. Emma's teacher was very nice and helped her feel more comfortable. She had a great first day!

Kelley has a serious case of writer's block. For the past hour, she has been struggling to finish her report. No matter how many ways she tried, the intro seemed lackluster. After writing and deleting her attempts, she gave up. She decided to go for a walk to clear her thoughts.
Mika was desperate for money. He decided to break into a neighbor's house. He stole some jewelry and money. He was caught within a week. Now he's facing jail time and thousands in fines.

Jason finally had to admit his kitchen was a mess. The floor was dirty and there were food stains everywhere. Jason bought some cleaning supplies. Jason spent all afternoon cleaning the kitchen. Jason's kitchen looked much nicer after the cleaning.

Angela was born into mob ties. She had steered clear of trouble thus far. One day, her father went to prison for murder. This scared Angela so much, she had to make a change. She cut all mob ties and moved to Vermont.

Bill went to buy candy at his local candy shop. He got his candy but he also met a pretty girl named Candy. After he got home he wished he would've gotten her number. He went to the store and asked the owner if he knew the girl. Candy was the owner's daughter, and Bill was asked to leave the store.

I went to a fancy restaurant over the weekend. To start things off, I insulted the host by not tipping. Then I incorrectly ordered off the weekday menu. Some of the patrons and staff started glaring at me. After my meal, I left the restaurant embarrassed and ashamed.

Sally wanted a new beagle puppy. She went to the pet store to look for one. She decided to not get a puppy from a pet store and go with a breeder. Sally found a beagle puppy from a breeder she liked. Sally bought the puppy and brought it home.

Bob was playing basketball with his neighbor. He shot the basketball over the rim. The basketball landed into the river next to his house. Bob chased after his basketball. The river was too fast and carried his basketball all the way down.

The mailman threw a huge box in front of my house. I took it inside and opened up the package. My new shelf was inside of the box. I eagerly took the parts and built the shelf in my room. Afterwards, I placed my school books in there.

Pippa sighed as she looked at her earnings for the evening. It had been a very long and tiring day. She wasn't going to bed until she met her goal though. Pippa ground out enough Zing hits to reach her goal. Pippa sighed contentedly as she snuggled into her sheets.
Eddie went fishing. He didn't realize there was a hole in his boat. The boat slowly started to fill with water. Eddie started to head back to shore. The boat reached land right as it started to sink.

Kelsey left for work for work one morning and forgot his coffee. He got to work and made a cup but it tasted really bad. So then he decided he would get a cup at lunch from the local shop. He finally got his coffee but it kept him up all night. Kelsey knows better than to forget his coffee in the morning.

Terry was going through a big issue. He started questioning everything around him. He started believing that he is the only one who exists. No matter how his friends and family tried to convince him he wasn't. He never would budge.
Claire wanted to cook for her husband. He loves pizza. She started to make the pizza dough. She rolled it out and added toppings. When it was done, it was delicious!

Jared was driving on the freeway. He accidentally ran over some metal debris on the road. Jared pulled over after the debris punctured one of his tires. He successfully swapped out the flat tire with the spare tire. After he changed the tire, he got home safely.

Peter got home from a long day of work. He was starving. He wanted to try a new type of cuisine so he went out for sushi. Peter ordered three different type of sushi rolls. Afterwards, he decided he had found a new favorite cuisine.

Cindy wanted her own puppy very much. She asked her mother if she could have one. Her mother told her to save her money and work hard for one. Cindy finally had saved up enough money with smart budgeting. The next day she went to the pet store and got her puppy.

Kim was in college and her classes started early. Kim was always tired in the mornings! So each night she started going to bed five minutes earlier. She found it easier to make such a small change. Soon she was sleeping longer and feeling better!
The old man next door has dementia. He was outside this morning. Concerned, I called his daughter. She told me he was singing and dancing. I laughed, and chose not to disturb him.

Martin went to camp with his friends. Martin and his friends found a nice camping spot. Suddenly, everyone discovered they had forgotten food. Martin was a skilled fisherman. Martin caught many fish so that everyone could eat.

Joey's mom was having a baby girl. He begged his mom and dad to name her LuLu. It was his very favorite name but they didn't sound convinced. It was an exciting day when his mom went to the hospital to have her. And when they told him her name was LuLu he was even happier.
Tim had never had a kiss. He tried to kiss a girl he liked. It was awkward and strange. Tim tried again. After a while they started dating.
Gina's class was in the library. She returned to her classroom early. The teacher wasn't in the room. Someone in her class had taken pencils from her. Gina decided to look for her stolen pencils.

Bob is extremely sick and thinks he has the flu. He has called in sick to work two days in a row. He keeps vomiting and coughing. Lucy gave Bob some medicine that she use to take. Within hours Bob started feeling better.

Monica had to pee, but her parents were already asleep. She tried to walk to the bathroom, but the floor creaked. Monica wrapped in a blanket and laid down on the floor. She started crawling to the bathroom like a worm. She made it to the bathroom without any cracking.

My best friend lives in New York. Last week I went to visit him. I took a train up to New York and had a great ride. He picked me up from the train station and we got some Pizza. It's always so good to see my friend in New York.

Naveet was very good at school. He would always get the highest grades in the class. When his exams came around, he didn't do as well as he'd hoped. His family were very strict, and he was extremely scared to tell them. He told them, but to his surprise they were very supportive.

Jack was visiting his grandparents for Christmas. He walked into their house and saw a toy train. He started to play with the train. Suddenly, the train became derailed. He quickly picked it up and reset it.

Paul goes to church every Sunday morning. On one particular Sunday, Paul was feeling very ill. He was determined to go to church anyway. Paul got out of bed and made it to church. After coming home Paul was tired but satisfied

Lydia went shopping for clothes. She brought back many items. Her husband said they couldn't afford those things. She told her husband she wanted a divorce. He reminded her he was also the only one with a job.

Today was Monday, the day Nora went to the library. Nora's Mom had to work, so Gramma offered to take Nora They got to the library very early for story time. The book for storytime was Curious George. Nora loves Curious George books.
The man went to prison. His cellmate tried to bully the man. The man fought his cellmate. He hurt his cellmate badly. The man got respect in the prison.

The weather prediction for today was very rainy. The rain storms throughout the day have become extreme. The local government issued a flood warning. The flooding has inspired an evacuation order. I plan to evacuate.

Casey was decorating her Christmas tree. She was putting up each ornament, when she found one broken. She didn't want it to go to waste, so she tried to fix it. Using glue, she put it back together. She hung it on the tree and his the cracked part.

Jill always complained about her homework. But she never attempted to do it. One day, another student tried to help her with homework. But he ended up finishing it for her. Jill was too lazy to thank him.

The Johnson family was going on to Hilton Head, South Carolina. When their plane arrived late in Denver, they missed the next plane. They had to spend a whole day in Denver. But they had fun time shopping and eating in Denver. They arrived a day late in South Carolina.

Chad has been lifting weights for years. He decided he wants to enter a bodybuilding show. He finds a show in Vegas and enters. Chad invites his friends to come watch him in the show. Chad flexes his muscles on stage.
Last night I was going to watch top chef. I had the television ready. Yet to my surprise the cable went out. I called the cable guy and he fixed it. When he left I was able to watch my show.

Bob undid the straps from his truck bed cistern. He grunted with effort and lifted it out of the truck. Bob carried it to his back porch, buckling under its weight. He set it down as gingerly as he could given its bulkiness. Bob was pleased he'd managed to unload it alone.

John always wanted to become a scientist. He loved animals and plants. So John studied in school and got a scholarship to college. In college John studied in biology. After college John became a biologist.

Maggie had spent all afternoon assembling a jigsaw puzzle. She had only five pieces left to place. However, she realized there were six holes left to fill! She looked all over the floor and couldn't find the missing piece. Discouraged, she was about to give up when she found it in her pocket!

Scott rubbed the sleep from his eyes. Another glorious morning could be seen through the open window. Time to get up and let the dog out. Tom's foot felt a squishy sensation when it met the floor. It was already too late to let the dog out to poop.

It was nearing the beginning of spring. Sam was excited for the warmer weather. He decided to plant some flowers he bought from the store. He dug holes in his front yard. He carefully placed the flowers in the holes.

Ziggy the dog sprained his leg last week. He has been walking with a visible limp. Yesterday I took him for a short walk around the block. About halfway home, he sat down and refused to move. I carried him the rest of the way home.

Kayla was going to a party. She needed to buy a present. However, Kayla did not have any extra money. She decided to get creative and make something. Kayla's present ended up being the best one at the party.
The kid picked out a pumpkin. He took it home to carve it. He made it look like a ghost. He put it on the front porch. He was ready for Halloween!

Gina's mother found a tape of cursing rap music. She took the tape away from the kids. They all followed her downstairs expecting to be in trouble. She didn't say a word to them just kept walking. They were more confused than ever when she went outside.
Teddy had gotten a new pair of glasses. His eyesight was still bad. Teddy was dizzy and having headaches. He went back to the optometrist. They had given Teddy the wrong prescription.

It was Friday Night at mom's house. We decided to play an old family game we used to play. We had so much fun, and it reminded me of old times. I decided to make this special and start a family game night weekly. Now that I have children, we still have family game night every Friday.
Sonya was ready for her first day at her new job. She was very nervous. Sonya dressed in her best outfit and headed out. The day was great. Sonya new she would love her new job.
Ali was arrested for a robbery. He was fingerprinted and photographed. Then they brought him to jail. A judge visited and gave him his sentence. Ali would be incarcerated for seven Years!

My 99 year old friend Ben sits on the bench a lot. Yesterday he told me he had enrolled in some courses. Brandeis has courses open for senior citizens. I asked him why he wanted to go to so many courses. He said if he keeps busy he won't die.
Jay was playing in a baseball game. He was standing on second base, ready to run. Jay ran and slid to the base. His arm got caught and he broke it. Jay couldn't play the rest of the season.

Cade is excited about his Christmas show. He has been practicing Jingle Bells all week. On the day of the show he is so nervous. On stage he looks out at the audience to find his mom. She is in the first row, so now he knows everything will be fine.

Emily just got a used washer and dryer. They worked very well at first. Suddenly, the dryer would turn on but not start. Emily looked up reasons why it might not start. It turns out the dryer door wasn't completely shut, so it starts now.

Lisa needed some extra money. She took one of her old rings to a pawn shop. She hoped to get at least $100 for it. But when the owner made her an offer, her eyes widened in joy. She was given $250 for her old ring!
I was walking home. While walking i passed a homeless man. He asked for some money. I gave him 10 dollars. He gave me great advice that i will remember forever.
Lulu had to go to the doctors. She was due for a shot. The thought scared her. She got all her stuff and headed over. When shot happened, lulu screamed.
Sam thought he was a Texan. He went to a bar with a mechanical bull. He figured it would be fun to show off. Sam got knocked off within a second. He walked off and pretended it didn't happen.
I went running with my friend. We met up at my house. We ran to the park and back. When we got back to my house, we realized we had run two miles. We were so proud of ourselves.
Randy was at an Indian restaurant. But he wasn't sure what to order. He remembered that saag paneer was a popular dish. So he ordered that with naan. Randy had never eaten anything so good before.

Malcolm decides he needs to leave his apartment at least once a day. He has barely left his bed today and is starting to feel lazy. Finally Malcolm gets up and takes a walk around his neighborhood. On his walk he sees a mighty slug. Malcolm is very happy that he left his apartment.
Ashley was anxiously awaiting the mail. She would check the mailbox every hour. Finally, it arrived. She ripped open the letter, eagerly. She had gotten into college!
Tom had been married for years. One day he caught his wife cheating. Tom demanded a divorce. His wife fought him every step of the way. The entire process took almost two years.
Tina was going to leave her house. But she noticed landscapers blocking the driveway. She was in a rush and upset. So she went and talked to them. Finally they ended up moving.

Pearl had a huge fear of going near the ocean. She was so afraid of ocean water that she ended her vacation plans. Her friends had invited her to a beach resort but Pearl declined. Her new vacation plan was to drive cross country visit national parks. Pearl spent her entire vacation alone sighting.

Gray had a lot of toys, but his favorite was his bouncing ball. The ball had a handle that he could hold on to while he bounced. He bounced on his ball every day, from morning until night. One day, Gray bounced so hard his bouncing ball popped. He was so sad, but his mom went and bought him another bouncing ball.

Joseph decided he wanted to learn to play a new instrument. He bought a guitar from the music store. He also bought a book which illustrated a few basic chords. He practiced these chords for many weeks. Joseph was finally able to play a full song on the guitar.

Chance was curious to what his dog does while he's gone. He set up a small camera to see what happens. Chance left the house. He turned on his phone app to watch. All he saw was his dog laying in front of the door for hours.
Jim was headed to school yesterday morning. It was freezing outside. He was bundled up, but he was still cold. Jim ran to school and slipped and fell. Thankfully, he wasn't hurt.

Tim is the star quarterback at Notre Dame. But he is failing in school. So his coach gets him a tutor. She helps him bring his grades up so that he can play. Tim and the tutor start dating and fall in love.

Lisa was a nurse at a hospital. She had a sick patient in Hospice that she liked very much. Lisa talked with her and bonded, even though they were dying. One day, Lisa went in with cookies, and saw that her patient was dead. She got so depressed, she took off work for weeks.

Roger bought his first new car a week ago. Ever since he bought it he's been taking the long drive to work. He was so happy that even morning rush hour didn't bother him. He thought his happiness could never end. His car was stolen the next day.

Cora was trying to make a Christmas gift budget. After adding it all together, she found it was unfeasible. Cora decided she needed to pare down some of the purchases. She cut her budget down by a third. Now Cora could afford to buy everything on her list.

Jen scheduled a haircut before her big date. She wanted her hair to look nice for the event. Her stylist cut her hair, but made a mistake! The haircut looked awful. Jen had to reschedule her big date.

I was tired but not ready to go to sleep yet. So I grabbed one of my books on American history. I read the first two chapters about our constitutional convention. I dozed off reading about the Connecticut compromise. Next thing I knew, sunlight was peeking at me through the window.

Bill wanted to learn how to defend himself. Bill signed up for martial arts lessons. Bill worked very hard and listened well. Bill advanced quickly through the levels of training. Now Bill is a black belt martial arts master.

Bradley was a chef. He loved cooking and eating his food. He loved to pair his food with different wine's. He drank too much wine while cooking and got drunk. He left his oil on the stove too long and burned down the restaurant.

Watson had always wanted to learn the saxophone. After talking to his parents, they bought him one. At first, he could not play anything. After a lot of hard work, he could play it. Now, Watson is very good at the saxophone.
The teacher called my mother. My mother told me about their conversation. My teacher says I have been absent a lot. She was mistaken. She confused me with another student.

John saw a used Jeep that he wanted to buy. He worked two jobs and saved all of his money. It took months but he finally had enough to buy the Jeep. When he went to the dealership, the Jeep was already sold. John end up buying a Ford Escape that he liked just as much.
Two children were eyeing a toy they wanted. One of them grabbed it. The other child grabbed it too. They both tugged and tugged at the toy. The teacher told them to share and so they did.

John saw a fire in his neighbor's house. He called the authorities. John heard a child screaming. John wanted to save the child since the authorities would be too late. John managed to save the child but his skin got burned as a result.

Last month we saw a constable post an eviction notice on a door. A week later the notice was still on the apartment door. A week after that i saw the constable come by and remove the notice. He said the law required sufficient notice of eviction. The next day, maintenance staff removed the unit's contents.

There was a leak in my kitchen pipes. I tried to call the plumber but he never answered the phone. I knocked on my neighbor's door and asked to borrow some sealant. He only had glitter glue. Now my pipes are covered in glitter, but at least they don't leak.

Neil had just learned about bioluminescence. He learned that dinoflagellates glowed when touched. He kayaked through the Maldives. There, he saw the amazing phenomenon. He was dazzled by the incredible display of beauty!

Sally was the manager of a restaurant. She had not been meeting the expectations of her job. She was careless in her work. Her boss fired her for talking on her phone too much. Sally filed for unemployment at her local government office after.

Eric spent the whole day working outside. Eric loved working all day. So when it came time for his evening shower he was reluctant. He wanted to keep working. However, Eric new it would be better if he came in and cleaned up.

Joe and Jane were two candidates for a job. Joe was knowledgeable and intelligent. However, the hiring manager liked Jane's personality. The hiring manager decided to flip a coin to decide who to hire. The coin landed on heads and Jane was hired.

James really liked Maria. Maria had a boyfriend. James felt like he could wait forever for a girl like her. He never tried to persuade her to leave her boyfriend. James was just thankful for the little moments they got to share.
Tom wanted to make some kool aid. He tried to mix in the sugar. Unfortunately he mixed it with flower. Tom tried to dissolve it and taste it. He realized his mistake on his first gulp.

Jeff took all the trimmings off of his Christmas tree. His wife suggested to give the tree a final shake. Jeff lifted the fake tree and gave a mighty shake. A few small ornaments fell from the tree. Because of this, Jeff searched harder for more.
My friend Ben was a soldier in WW2. One day he was in Italy. He met a violinist on the street. Ben paid him money to play classical music for an hour. Ben wrote a poem about the experience.

Henry left a box of salted crackers on top of the table. His twin kids managed to take it by using a stool. Since they didn't have lunch yet, they devoured the crackers. When Henry came back into the living room, he found the box. It was lying on the ground, empty inside.
The man hung up the phone. The woman wondered why. The woman called him back. The man didn't answer. The woman thought she knew why.

Eliza had to do a trust fall in gym class. She climbed the rope unsteadily. Then, shaking, she closed her eyes and fell backwards. A net of friends caught her and lowered her to safety. Eliza smiled, realizing she truly could trust her friends.

It was Lauren's birthday. Her boyfriend, Darin, gave her a small box with a bow on it. Curious, Lauren untied the bow and opened the lid. A puppy greeted her and licked her face. Lauren screamed with delight.
There was a new theater in town. The family decided to try it out. The seats were comfortable. The popcorn was the best! They decided to go to that theater from now on.

I walked into a liquor store. I bought a lottery ticket at the store. The lottery ticket had my favorite numbers listed on it. I checked the newspapers for the winning numbers. I did not win the lottery.
Abby was invited to a Taylor swift concert. She was very excited to attend. As soon as she went it was packed. Abby had fun with all the songs. She couldn't wait to buy the new album.

Kim wanted to make Valentines for her class. She got construction paper, glue, and glitter. Kim stayed up all night making cards for everyone. At school, she passed out her Valentines. She smiled as she watched her friends enjoy their cards.

Sam bought his girlfriend flowers. He was going to take them to her at her work. On the way there he got sidetracked at a store. Sam forgot the flowers on the roof of his car. By the time he remembered the weather had messed them up.

Dani likes to spend a lot of money. She spent so much that she was $100,000 in debt. It came to a point where she was forced to file for bankruptcy. The day after she filed for bankruptcy she went to buy a new car. Despite the bankruptcy she was able to get a loan to buy a new car.

Donald just wanted some ice cream. Donald saw Mary crying in the park. Donald asked Mary what's wrong. Mary had two ice cream cone and no one to share with. Donald took an ice cream cone and Mary became happy!

Frank was laughing so hard he started crying. His dog fell into the trash and couldn't get out. He took a video of it and posted it online. After a week Frank had over 10000 views. Frank knew this was as famous as he would ever be.
Tom asked Allie on a date. Allie said yes. Tom drove Allie to a movie. They went to dinner next. They had a good time.
Anna wanted fruit. But she had none in her house! She went out to the backyard. There, she pulled a few bananas off the tree. Then she went in and ate her fruit.

Mary missed her marketing class because she overslept. She was supposed to take a major exam that day. Mary told the professor that she had been ill. The professor asked Mary to provide a note from her doctor. When Mary couldn't provide a doctor's note, she failed the exam.
Jeremy is a skinny guy. He looked at all these images of hot guys. He decided to lift weights. He did it for 2 weeks straight. He ended up giving up.

Bert dreamed of being able to write and read. He went to the local community center and asked for help. He found other people like him who had the same dream. And every day they worked together to improve their skill. A year later, they all could read the paper and write a letter.

Carter's dad just bought him a new trampoline. Him and Jim played on it all day yesterday. While they were playing on it Jim fell off. When Jim fell he skinned his knee. Carter's parents put a bandaid on it and now Jim is ok!

Rob ran for his high school track team. He was a sprinter with very fast speed. He was practicing on the track one day. But he twisted his ankle badly. He foot grew two times the normal size that day.

Chris is a garbage man and gets up at two every morning. He usually drinks energy drinks but wants to stop. He doesn't need all the sugar but likes the caffeine. He decided to switch and to drink black coffee on his route. It works just fine and he is more productive than ever.

Richie's parents were gone for the weekend. He had the whole house to himself! Richie invited all his friends to come over. Richie and his friends partied all night long. Richie cleaned up the mess that they made the next morning.

My favorite time of day is early in the morning. I get up at 5 and begin the day in peace and quiet. I take care of the dogs and begin some laundry. I have almost 2 hours to myself before I begin work. This is my time to regroup and get ready for a busy day of work.

Jorge realized his closet was overflowing. He decided to clean it out and throw away anything he wasn't using. He kept digging and finding more stuff he forgot about. The throw away pile became huge. In the end, Jorge's closet ended up looking almost empty!

Maxine has always dreamed of being on her school's volleyball team. Her friends and family tell her that volleyball is not ladylike. However, she persists in following her dream. Maxine practices every day and becomes to volleyball team captain. She is so happy that her dream of playing volleyball has come true.

Mike had to find someone to bring to the dance. He was a geeky guy who loved video games and rarely socialized. Not many people liked him, let alone even knew that he existed. He mustered up the courage and asked around. When he finally gave up, Lucy came up to him and asked him to go.

Martin and his mom went to the zoo. They saw monkeys, tigers, lions, and even penguins. They also talked with a zookeeper about the animals. They spent all day at the zoo, having an amazing time. On the way home, Martin told his mom he wanted to be a zookeeper.
Mickey was walking barefoot in his house. He stepped on something. His foot started throbbing. He looked at his foot. There was a toothpick stuck in his foot.

Jake had just moved into his college dorm. He wanted to make his study area as comfortable as possible. The chair that was in his room was old and stiff. Jake found a really nice leather computer chair on craigslist. Jake was able to buy the chair for $50 used.

Johnny called his father and told him the good news. He was promoted to editor at his job. He invited his father over but his father said no. Johnny went to his father's house and his father wasn't home. Johnny left a bottle of champagne on his father's porch.

Sandy was watching a video on Youtube. At the end of the video, there was a poem scrolling. Sandy felt that the poem looked familiar. Upon research, Sandy discovered it was a poem she wrote. Sandy was glad to see her poem visualized on the screen.
I went out and bought a new computer yesterday. I really needed a new one. I immediately went to the nearest store. When I got there there was only one left. I instantly snagged it.

Alan's dad bought him a pistol for his eighteenth birthday. He took Alan to the range so they could learn to shoot. At first Alan was a very poor shot. But as he practiced, his aim improved. Soon Alan a better shot than even his dad!

There was a large festival in front of my school. Many people hung out, took pictures and ate food. A large thunderstorm occurred around the school. Everyone got soaked. However, it didn't stop them from having a good time.
One day Eric decided to build a bomb shelter. He got to work building the rooms. Then he started storing food. Then he brought entertainment. When he was done he was proud of himself.
It was crazy hair day. Tina was happy about that. This was because she could experiment with it. Tina ended up winning. She was happy about that.
I needed a haircut. I didn't have any money. Instead, I decided to cut it myself. I grabbed a chunk of my hair. Then, I chopped the piece off.
Andrea was at the annual city kite fest. She saw a table offering kites. In order to get a kite, you had to donate canned food. Andrea had brought a can of soup. She donated and got a free kite.
Frank wanted to go camping with friends. Nobody went with him. He decided to go by himself. Unfortunately he got lost getting to the campsite. Frank had to call for help and get saved.

Mya was scared of the darkness ever since she was a toddler. She told her friends that the darkness would one day make her vanish. She was scared to sleep alone so she slept with her best friend. One night while she was out drinking she never returned home. Her last text was a picture of a dark corner with nothing else in it.

Jimmy loves to play video games. He buys many games to play online with his friends. His favorite game is a first person shooter style. He talks with his friends over the internet while playing it. Jimmy plays so much he is ranked number one out of his friends.

Water skiing is fun when you know what you're doing. That's what I've been told by those who seem to know. For me it felt more like being put on the rack. You know, that medieval torture device that pulled your limbs apart. I hope never to experience that kind of fun again!
Tom wanted to make a show. He started drawing and writing. He started putting stuff on youtube. It started to get popular. He got a email from a tv company.
Amy heard a noise. There was a kitten trapped in the sewer! She used a stick to grab ahold of it. The kitten was hungry and wet. Amy took it home and took care of it.

Dan's son Alex was sick. Alex vomited all over the couch. After putting Alex to bed Dan had to clean the couch. He cleaned and cleaned but it still smelled of vomit. He ended up spraying Febreeze to mask the scent.

Olivia is in high school. Her favorite subject is math because she is good at it. She doesn't like science and therefore doesn't study it much. She ended up doing poorly on all of her science exams this year. Because of this, she had to take retake science classes in the summer.
John hated going to funerals. His grandmother had recently passed. John decided not to go to the funeral. His family was very disappointed in his decision. John didn't care and stayed home.

I never meant for this love to happen. He told himself as he walked aimlessly through the night. Memories flooding his brain, as he focused on the only thing he could. One foot in front of the other, and you'll reach your destination. I never meant for things to come undone, but so it goes.

Wanda was cleaning her house. She cleaned the kitchen. Then she started to clean her livingroom. She was dusting all of her furniture. While dustin she knocks over a really expensive vase her mom gave her.
I had a hunk of cheese in my refrigerator. It was behind a big jar. I forgot about it since I couldn't see it. I moved the jar yesterday. The cheese had more hair on it than my dad.
Jena was driving late at night. She saw an animal on the road. Jena swerved to miss the animal. The car hit the ditch. Jena had to call a tow truck.
The woman tried to tie a turban. It kept falling off of her friend. Her friend helped her tie it. It fell of her head again. She took off the turban.

Billy wanted to be president of the United States. Billy bribed local politicians and rose to power in politics. Billy then ran for president for the Democratic party. Billy garnered enough votes after election were held. Billy then became president of the United States.

Blake was ready to move from his home state. He was dating a girl who moving back to her home state soon. Blake loved the girl and was willing to move with her. He packed up all his stuff and moved his whole life. Unfortunately after three months the girl broke up with him.

My husband and I got an opportunity to go to Hawaii for five months. Sadly we could not take our elderly cat with us because of quarantine. Greg reluctantly agreed to take care of her despite allergies. Out of the blue, Greg told us he was going to take her to the pound. Brian, also allergic, saved the day by rescuing our kitty.

Jay loved apple pie, especially homemade from his grandma. But his grandma couldn't afford apples often, so he rarely got pie. Then one day Jay noticed three apple trees in his neighborhood! He picked dozens of apples and brought them to his grandma. She made him three pies and he stuffed himself silly!

Jill and her family live on the fourth floor, as we do. We live in Cambridge, Massachusetts. One day a Bob and his family moved in. Jill told me Bob looked familiar. It turned out Bob lived in her dorm at Northwestern, 20 Years ago.

Chris decided to get a new phone. He couldn't decide if he wanted an iPhone or and Android. The store clerk suggested he go with an iPhone. Chris decided to go with the iPhone. His credit card was declined unfortunately.

I bought a townhouse that was a foreclosure. My wife and I moved in and realized it needed some work. Together we fixed up the house and gave it a total makeover. We stayed one year then put it on the market. Someone bought it for a higher price than we originally did!

Sarah was at the movies on a saturday. She sat in the back so she could see the screen best. Next to her was a mom and a little baby. The baby was smelly. Sarah had to move seats so she didn't have to smell the stink.

The carpenter was very skilled at what he did. He worked day and night to make quality custom furniture. One night he was very sleepy but insisted on finishing a piece. He accidentally hammered his finger and had to go to the hospital. Luckily nothing was broken and he was back to carpentry in no time.

I went to New York City to sing last year. I went to Central Park to get some nice pictures. On they way back, I saw a street market. I was so engrossed in the market, I got lost. I had to walk many extra blocks to get back to my hotel!

Mary was interested in dining at a new restaurant in town. She had called for weeks to try and get a reservation. After weeks of calling she was finally able to get a table. Mary ordered chicken and rice and received her chicken under-cooked. Mary was disappointed and left a bad review.

The smoke permeated the entire room. I could feel it getting hotter with the door closed. I didn't say anything because I didn't want to be offensive. I felt like my nostrils were closing up on me. I could barely breathe from all the smoke.

Sal took out all his money from the bank. He gave it to a stock broker to invest. The broker put all the money in a risky stock. Two months later the stock doubled in price. Sal sold his shares and collected his money.
Mindy was scared of roaches. She thought they would one day take over the world. One day she got out of bed for a glass of water. She saw a roach on the floor. Mindy nearly fainted.

Birds are fun to watch and listen to. There are many birds in our city. We went downtown and sat on a park bench. Pigeons left many wet droppings and Mike got some on his shirt. Maybe not all birds are fun.

Gina decided not to cry at her grandpa's funeral. She wanted to remain composed. She would cry when she was alone. But as the pastor spoke she glanced at the body. The ensuing wave of emotion forced her to cry against her will.

Jake went to the animal shelter looking to adopt. When he arrived, he found a beautiful brindled dog. The dog's name was Sophia and she and Jake clicked immediately. Jake went to the front desk and asked to adopt Sophia. Sophia and Jake have been best friends ever since.
Josh Turner was a paleontologist. When he retired, he moved to a small town. He built a museum there. The museum became very successful. His work inspired many children who visited.

Charlie challenged his friends. He would pay anyone who could take a coin from his hand. Everyone jumped on Charlie. Nobody was able to get the coin from him. Charlie laughed and the boys went to get ice cream.

I decided I wanted to build a garden last week. After some looking, I purchased the plants I intended to grow. It didn't take long to sort out my yard. Adding the fertilizer, I waited a few days for it to settle. A few months later, I had an amazing garden!
Hales found out she was pregnant. Her boyfriend thought he was trying to trap her. They got into a huge fight. He broke up with her. Now she is a single mom.

I went to the bank to take out money. The teller informed me that I was broke. He said I spend too much money when I get it. I decided to open up a savings account. Now I was able to save some of the money from my paycheck.

I like going to a brewery a few blocks from my house. It has a very convenient location for me. It offers free pint glasses on each patron's first tour. I have a cabinet full of those pint glasses. I simply buy the tour any time I see a new employee.

Today was street cleaning day. Any car parked across from our building would be towed. At 9 AM, three tow trucks drove up and started towing. A woman ran quickly across the street. She was lucky to avoid being towed.

Cal shut the door to his house behind him and started down the steps. He slipped on the wet concrete and skidded down them. Cal broke his tailbone and tore his clothes! He brushed himself off and drove himself to the hospital. The nurses couldn't believe he'd done so while in so much pain.

Joe was a single dad to a 13-year-old girl, Sammi. One day he decided it was time to talk to Sammi about female things. Awkwardly, he perched on her bed and tried to explain menstruation. Then he briefly, blushing, explained about sex and contraception. Finally, Sammi told him the internet had answered her questions.
Dean went hunting with his friends. He shot a deer. Dean brought the deer home. He had the deer processed. The deer fed his family for months.

Molly woke up very nervous for her first day of middle school. Her mom told her that she would lover her new school. While driving to school Molly began to think about seeing her friends. As soon as she got out of the car her friends greeted her with smiles. When Molly got home, she knew it was going to be a great year.

Miley was trying to charge her cell phone. The connector was getting sort of loose and it didn't charge well. Finally she decided to order a new charger online. It arrived within a couple of days. She loved it, it charged her phone much better.
The man tried on a fake mustache. He snuck up behind his wife. He spoke to her in a deep voice. His wife turned around. She jumped back in surprise at the mustache.

Veronica wanted to learn to play the violin. Veronica conducted research to find a qualified teacher. Once she found a teacher, she decided to visit the teacher's studio. After the visit, Veronica decided to sign up for the lessons. Veronica was excited to be learning to play the violin.

Nicole loved to go on long runs. She ran every day after work. She decided she needed a new challenge for her running. She chose to enter a marathon. After months of training, Nicole ran the marathon.
The creature hid in fear. Some time passed. The creature poked it's head out. A predator grabbed the creature's head with it's teeth. The creature was ate for lunch.

Camilla was at the park with friends. They discovered a nice smelling bush of flowers. One of the kids said that it was honeysuckle and tasted it. Camilla thought it was a trick but she tried a taste. To her surprise, it was sweet like honey.
Larry was making a sandwich. He got all the ingredients ready and prepared it. When he took a bite it tasted terrible. He looked around and noticed the meat package. It had expired a month ago!

My friend invited me to his house. I got in my car and drove for a few hours. I showed up and we went inside and had a beer. We watched tv and ate some pizza. I stayed the night and we talked for a while.

Adam was a great tennis player. He won many awards playing tennis for clubs and at his school. Adam was about to graduate. A college offered him a tennis scholarship. Adam accepted the scholarship and attended the college.

It was a beautiful night out. Jill called her friends over for a bonfire. Jill had no wood for the fire. Marcus coincidentally brought over extra wood. Jill and her friends spent the night around the fire.

Our internet was down on Monday. I picked up a local newspaper to read. I had forgotten how hard it was to fold the paper. I managed to read one article before giving up. Thankfully, the internet came back on today.
Dan needed some quick cash. He decided to go by his bank. He tried to take money out of the ATM but it was broken. Dan had to go in to do it. They apologized to him for the inconvenience.

Rob checked in to his hotel in Houston. After he entered his room, he began unpacking his belongings. It was then that Rob realized he had forgotten his toothbrush. He went to the front desk to ask for assistance. The front desk gave him a new toothbrush to keep.
James went to Las Vegas for vacation. He decided to play blackjack. He was having a very lucky streak! He put all of his money on one hand. He lost everything.
Alicia wanted the iPad mini. It was selling for a discounted price on sale. She called the store to see if they had it. The store said there was one left. Luckily she was able to snag it.

Ginger's grandmother could no longer take care of herself. Ginger decided to move her grandmother into an assisted living center. Her grandmother was reluctant, but agreed to the move. Her grandmother did not like the assisted living center. She was much happier when Ginger suggested that she move in with her.
Kelly was given an engagement ring. Kelly wore it to work the next day. Kelly's coworker got jealous. Kelly's coworker stole the ring. Kelly never got the ring back.

Pedro worked in a small diner. When the diner had to close it was a tragedy in town. Most locals had eaten there for the last twenty years. To avoid its closure, they all pitched in. And thanks to everyone, Pedro kept the diner open.
Sally knew her favorite show would be on at 9. She ran out to her car from work late. She drove kinda fast. She ran inside. She caught her show just in time.

Doug took his new puppy to obedience classes. His dog learned things very quickly. In no time at all he was sitting and shaking hands by command. Doug thinks the course was a great idea. He knows the course prepared the pup for doing more around others.

Ike checked his watch and saw he was going to be late. He picked up his walking pace and went into a jog. He ran into the theater and handed his ticket to the usher. The play started but he was allowed inside. There was an open seat in the back row and he took it.

My friend could talk exactly like pee wee herman. We talked like him for fun after school. Sometimes we went to his house to watch the show. We would make popcorn and sit on the floor. We laughed and had a lot of fun.

My girlfriend and I went to the beach. The beach was very, very crowded. We hemmed and hawed about staying or leaving. She asked me what I thought, and I asked her what she thought. We both agreed to leave, so we got in my car and went back home.
Janice had stayed up late. She had planned on sleeping in on Saturday morning. Janice accidentally set her alarm to ring. The alarm woke Janice in the morning. Janice couldn't go back to sleep.

One day a new car showed up in our building's garage. The car was covered and we were curious. Last week the owner took the cover off. It was a restored 1965 Mustang. I took a selfie and posted it on Snapchat.
Sam was cold. It was the middle of winter. She went to the store. She bought a new scarf and hat. She felt warmer with her new clothing.

I used to live in the desert. One night, I woke up and went to the bathroom. As I was sitting there, I noticed something moving on the floor. It was a scorpion! I screamed so loud I woke up everyone in the house.

Johnny wanted to meet new people. He wanted to meet likeminded people. He joined a local book club. He enjoyed the discussions and meetings for many reasons. He had a great time meeting and interacting with good people.

Kelly was shopping for Halloween pumpkins. Her local store wasn't known for their fresh produce. Kelly could only find brown mottled pumpkins. Finally she spotted on large perfect pumpkin. It took some yanking but she pulled it from the pile.

When Joy was nine she and her best friend Beth both got puppies. The puppies were from the same litter. Joy got a boy and named him Pippin. Beth got a girl and named her Sweet Pea. They have spent many hours together over the last eleven Year's!

Mary had a baby pomapoo puppy. She named her puppy Pookie because she liked how it sounded. Pookie's hair was white with some tints of beige around her ears. They would often play together for hours at a time. At night, Mary and Pookie would share a bed and fall asleep together.
Tim wanted to buy a car. He found one he liked. He tried to get credit for it. Unfortunately his history wasn't that good. Tim wasn't able to get the car.

Ben loved street racing. He and his friends would load up in his car every night and race. Eventually his youthful foolishness caught up to him. He lost control of the car and landed in a ditch. Everyone was ok but he doesn't have a car to race in now.

Ann planted a tree when she was very young. As she aged, the tree did, too. When she graduated from high school, the tree was twenty feet tall. Ann moved away a long time ago. When she visited last week, she drove by again to see how tall it is.
Bob had a job interview coming up. He'd let his hair grow a bit long. He asked his friend Ana to cut it for him. She gave him a hideous looking bowl cut. Bob wore a hat to his job interview.
Last week I came back from Australia. The trip was absolutely amazing. I don't think I had a better trip. We stayed for about three weeks. I can't wait to go back next year.
Yesterday Tina went to a seafood restaurant. She ordered the shrimp. To her dismay when she received it, it was not right. It was undercooked. Tina had to send it back.
Sally needed a dress for her event. She could not find one anywhere. She finally found the perfect one. However, it was too expensive. Sally was disappointed she couldn't buy it.

Kayla suspected her husband of cheating She had looked through his texts and emails She saw a lot of strange calls and texts to an unknown number Kayla Decided to take action She tracked down the number's location and found her cheating Husband!

Mark realized he was overweight and decided to go on a diet. He bought some sugar-free cream that was 10 calories a serving. Every day he would pour this cream into his coffee. After a month he found out that he gained 10 pounds. The label said it was 100 calories, not 10, thanks to a smudge on it.

Tom's father was a soldier. Tom's father was fighting a war far away. Tom prayed every day for his father's safe return. One day, Tom saw several people walking to his house. They told him his father had died in the war.

My friend Sara and I were really bored yesterday. We decided to go swimming and we couldn't decide where we should go. She searched online for places nearby that would let us swim for free. After we found the perfect place, we got our things together. We swam all day and I got a sunburn!
Tom got a new puppy. It was still not housebroken. Tom needed to leave it alone for a while. The dog went crazy all over the house. Tom spent all night cleaning up after it.
Some uncles shared a Thanksgiving meal. They ate a lot of meat. One of them felt really sick. He went to the bathroom. He threw up.

One hot afternoon I was driving toward a gas station. I had foolishly neglected getting gas and my tank was almost empty. Just when the station was in sight, my car puttered out.
