I had to walk to the station and back in sweltering mid-summer heat. Now, I refill my gas tank twice a week without fail!

Carl went to the casino to see a show. On the way to the theater he passed the roulette table. The pit boss suggested that Carl take a chance and play. Carl put down $5 on red. The ball came up black and Carl felt terrible.
The man grimaced. The dentist noticed. The dentist asked if he was in pain. The man said that he was. The dentist gave him laughing gas.

Carolyn volunteered to throw her sister a baby shower. She went to the store to pick up all the decorations. Carolyn sent invitations to all her sister's friends. She picked up the cake on the morning of the shower. After a busy party, Carolyn was glad the shower was over.

Riley grew up in a baseball family. His father was a professional player. He would have to continue this legacy by trying out for varsity. He tried out and left an impression. He is now on the Varsity team.

Anna was only partly enjoying her road trip to Florida. Then she spotted orange and grapefruits groves. She ran to pick fresh citrus fruit and eat it. She even picked a tiny, yellow lime! Anna ended up having a wonderful trip!

Roma wanted to see the world, but she was very poor. With the help of the internet, however, she made a plan. She crowd-funded tickets and found couches to sleep on for free. Finally Roma left for her exciting backpacking adventure. She was gone five happy months and only spent $100!

Mike was playing computer games. All of a sudden, his computer started to freeze. His computer was overheating. Mike bought a new CPU cooler from the electronics store. He installed the cooler and fixed his freezing problems.

I took my girlfriend to my cousin's wedding. It was a lovely ceremony. When it came time to throw the bouquet everyone lined up. My girlfriend wound up catching it. She hasn't stopped talking about marriage since then.

Louis leaned over to look out the window. He totally forgot there was a cactus plant. It brushed up against his face. Some of the needles went into his skin. His mom spent nearly an hour pulling them out.

Jenny pulled forcefully on the kitchen window shade. It dangled limply in her hands, instead of rolling up as it should. Jenny yanked it much harder than she had before. The shade snapped loudly out of its holder. Jenny has a big bruise on her forehead from where it smacked her.
Jay always slept with a teddy bear. He couldn't sleep without it. One day he left it at school. Jay did not think he would sleep. However, his mother bought him a new stuffed animal.

Sue loved oranges. She would eat them all the time. One day during the holidays she was given an orange made of chocolate. It was confusing at first to her. But she ended up liking orange flavored chocolate even more.
Little Timmy is too young for action movies. But he loves watching them anyway. He sometimes sneaks into the theater. Or rents a movie from redbox. His parents don't know how to stop him.

Cindy wanted to drink with her friends. She drink way too much and felt terrible. She passed out and her friends were concerned. They called 911 and an ambulance picked her up. She had gotten alcohol poisoning from too much liquor.

Horace notices that the lightbulb in his bathroom is dead. He decides he needs to replace it. After replacing the bulb, the light works perfectly. Now Horace can see in his bathroom. Horace is glad the lightbulb in his bathroom is no longer dead.

Gina was being dropped of at her grandma's. She hadn't wanted to go, but she had no choice. As she pulled up she saw her cousins sitting on the porch. Gina felt a sense of dread. She hated spending time with her stuck up cousins.

Tammy wanted to write an article for a magazine. She thought long and hard about what to write. She wrote an article about wage discrepancies among different groups. She submitted her article for publication. After many rejections, a magazine ran Tammy's article.
Susie was very upset. She couldn't clear her mind. So she went on youtube. She put on mediation music. She then started to feel better.
On July 4th I went to a fireworks show. The fireworks were very loud. They were also very pretty. Everyone in the audience was amazed by them. I thought it was very cool to see fireworks.

Tonight, my husband brought home a bottle of wine. He had a hard day at work and wanted to enjoy a nice dinner at home. We ordered take out and drank our wine. He told me about his day. Things will be better tomorrow.

Ziggy the dog often jumps up on the back of the couch. There is a gap between the cushions where he likes to sit. One day paw slipped between the cushions and got caught. The vet thinks that it is sprained. Now Ziggy refuses to go up and down the stairs.

Alex was walking to work one morning. Then, he noticed a news crew outside of his favorite coffee shop. He stopped to listen in for a moment. Then, they motioned him over to ask him some questions. Alex got to talk about his favorite type of coffee on the news.

Barry was a very poor man with an talent for painting. He didn't sell his works for very much profit because he was ignorant. Barry wound up living in an alley and using old scraps for his art. He wound up creating his very own masterpiece in the alley. A wealthy passerby saw the man's work and bought it for a large sum.

Shay and the girls decided to take a trip. She wanted to take a girls trip to Miami. The girls got together and went for a week. They had a great time. At the end of the trip they didn't want to leave.
Beth was home alone. She heard a noise in the kitchen. She was too scared to investigate. She called her brother Jake to come over. She locked her door and waited in her room.
Fiona was driving her car one wintry day. She hit a patch of black ice. Her car started spinning uncontrollably. She had never felt so scared in her life. Her car stopped on a flat median.
Reagan woke up at six in the morning. He got ready for work. He spent less time than he anticipated. He decided to stop for a treat on his way to work. He bought himself an iced coffee.

It was a beautiful fall day and the Smiths went apple picking. They traveled to their favorite orchard. It took about an hour to get there but it was worth it. As soon as they got there they started picking. But the time they were done they picked 100 apples.

Tom decided to visit Mexico. He heard there were a lot of great beaches there. When Tom got to Mexico he was very confused. He didn't seem to be able to understand what people were saying. Tom thought it was like they were speaking a whole other language.
I gave the waiter my cash. It was time to pay. I had never paid at a restaurant before. He was having a party. I was with my brother close to his wedding.

I flew to Kansas to meet my fiance. When I got off the plane, he was not at the airport waiting for me. I called his cell phone and he told me he was with his girlfriend. I told him that I'm going to keep the engagement ring. I bought a ticket home using his credit card.
Eric stepped up to the plate. He bent his body to prepare. He swung the bat. The bat hit the ball. It went over the fence.
She named the puppy Prissy. Prissy loved to run in the dining room. She ran circles around the table. She panted as she ran. Everyone laughed at her antics.
Today, we lost the remote control. Everyone was looking for it. Madyx found it under the jumper. She gave it to me. Now we can watch television.

The boy applied to college. He received a letter back from the college. He waited for everybody to get home. He opened the letter in front of his family. Everyone was disappointing that he was not accepted.

I was away at college, and had a long distance relationship. I knew my boyfriend had become distant, but I trusted him. One day, I was talking to his father on the phone. His father told me that he was cheating on me badly. I broke up with him and never looked back.

Morgan was standing patiently. SHe had a new dress that was being altered. The seamstress was the best in the business. She worked carefully and soon the dress was ready! Morgan twirled around and smiled at her reflection.
He wasn't who I thought he would be. Instead of healing my heart, he broke it further. He spoke cruel words every day. He abused me and made me feel worthless. I began to wish I wasn't alive.

Albert was very excited. He called up a Science magazine to talk to a reporter. Albert proclaimed vast amounts of silica deposits were on Mars. He explained it could mean there really had been lots of water. Albert finished the interview and went back to Scienceing at NASA.
Flo had allergies. She was visiting a botanical garden with her family. Flo began to sneeze. Her eyes started to water. Flo had to leave the garden before she got sick.

Mike was a general manager for a hotel. The property was not doing well financially. Mike needed answer to turn the situation around. Mike hired a consultant. After making adjustments, the hotel is doing better financially.

I knew a strange kid named Matt in elementary school. Other kids would bully Matt because he was so different. One day I saw Matt being bullied on the playground. Suddenly, Matt took a swing at the bully, hitting him in the face. Matt never got bullied again.

Danisha was looking for her headphones. She wanted to listen to music on the train. She couldn't do that without her headphones. After searching through her things, she gave up. Danisha was in a bad mood after that.

Kevin was having a bunch of friends over. His mom liked for him to have playdates. The kids all ran around and played with nerf guns. They screamed and laughed and had a great time. Kevin asked if they could come over the next day as well.

Gary loved his hometown. He knew all the sights and activities, and he adored them all. After high school he decided on his perfect job. Gary wasn't leaving home for college like most of his friends. He stated put - abs became a successful tour guide in his hometown!

The class walked into the room to sit down. When I sat down, the chair started rumbling. In a few seconds, it completely collapsed. I feel on my back and the class ended up laughing. The teacher asked if I was okay, but I just nodded.
Sadie had just gotten off from work. It was a bit later than usual. She had to walk home in the dark that day. As she was walking, she heard someone behind her. Nervous, she ran the rest of the way.
Ted is a firefighter. While fighting a massive fire he slips and falls. He falls through the floor. He can't get up in time. The fire consumes him and he dies.

Early Saturday morning as I sat reading my Bible a butterfly flew by. I paused my study to enjoy such a beautiful site. The creatures wings were blue rimmed in black. She hovered over my rose bush for a moment before moving on. I watched her until she faded away and then resumed my study.
Ben decided to run a marathon. He went through a marathon training during last year. Every morning he ran 5 miles. He was very excited when marathon day came. He was happy he made it to the end.

Lucy made herself sick eating cake. The problem was she had stolen the cake. Her grandma was perplexed as to what could have made her sick. Lucy couldn't tell her about the cake. Lucy pretended she had no idea what caused her tummy ache.

I didn't have any food to take to work on Monday. After work on Sunday, I went to the store. My favorite frozen dinner was on sale. I bought five and brought them to work the next day. Now I have food for the rest of the work week.

Jasmine played in the poker tournament last night. She was really nervous, but she played well. A big pot developed at the final table. Jasmine had three aces but lost all of her chips. She was satisfied with her third place finish and the prize money.
There is a tunnel under the river. You are not allowed to walk through it. I wondered why. There is a lack of oxygen there. I found that out when using a motorcycle.

Quentin had always wanted to swim at a nearby lake. His friends organize a trip to the lake one day. Quentin packs his swimming trunks and joins them on the trip. When they get to the lake, he is the first to dive in! Quentin feels proud that he has finally swam at the lake.
Fred had always wanted to visit Spain. He saves his money for a big trip. Finally it is time for him to visit. He eats great food and meets interesting people. Fred feels happy that he visited Spain.
I woke up one night to loud noises. I got up to find the source of the noise. I heard faint barking outside my backdoor. I looked out the window and saw a dog barking at my door. I went back to bed.

Homer is hungry. Homer can't wait for his lunch break at work. When his lunch break comes he heads out to grab something to eat. He visits a donut shop to buy some donuts. He eats his donuts on his lunch break.

Liza was ready to make some potato chips in the kitchen. She got potatoes ready and her slicer to cut the vegetables. Liza sliced each potato into thin pieces and placed them in the oil. The slices cooked within a few minutes and were crisp chips. The chips tasted delicious to Liza and she was content with them.

Jeff listens to music while working out at the gym. He hates how the cord of his headphones always gets in the way. He saw a guy at the gym with wireless headphones. Jeff looked them up on amazon and bought a pair. He now works out cord free and with no distractions.

Amy and Seth were laying on the grass looking up at the clouds. They were pointing out shapes to each other. After a while Seth pointed out a heart but Amy couldn't see it. He reached towards her to point her in the right direction. When he did she kissed him for the first time.

Our neighbor Tracy has a boy and a girl in elementary school. Ava is 9 and Charles is 7. Tracy said Charles is already having trouble concentrating. She said this always happens the first week of school. She said he will get better next week.
Richards loves the drum. He picks up his drumsticks. Then goes to his practice room. Richard sits down at his drum kit. Finally, he plays a beat on his drums.
Tyler played football with a team. Today was their big day. He was nervous but did well. He scored a touchdown. Everyone cheered him on.

Dan was getting dressed for a formal event. He was trying to tie his tie. It always came out too short or too long. In frustration he gave up and threw the tie on the ground. Dan went without a tie to the event.
Tim was born a boy. But he always felt like a girl. He decided to have gender reassignment surgery. He soon looked like a girl on the outside. He was so happy to finally look like himself!
Kelly really wanted a new pair of shoes. She decided to head over to jimmy choo. It was her favorite store. She ended up getting a fitting. She purchased the first pair she tried on.

Jim was a computer programmer. He had gotten his degree from the University of Illinois. He was developing a new program to graph volcano activity. He spent many months developing this program. When it was completed, he sold the program to Google.
Sam was doing laundry. He decided to do his girlfriend's as well. He put all her clothes in one load. Some of her items were ruined. Sam's girlfriend was upset.

Randi wanted to spruce up her bedroom. She bought a new duvet. It was fluffy and white and beautiful. She felt relaxed and refreshed when she was in her bed now. She decided to buy matching pillows to complete the look.

All the girls in Allie's class were invited to Beth's birthday party. Except for Allie, that is. That made her very sad. The day before, Beth asked her why she hadn't RSVP'd. Allie was invited but accidentally hadn't gotten an invitation.
Joe was playing quarterback in a football game. Joe was tackled by a lineman. He was slow to his feet. As soon as Joe got up he fell right back down. Joe had to be carted off the field.

Neil was visiting Mongolia. His tour guide took him to see traditional homes, called yurts. Then he saw real yaks. He even took a drink of yak milk! Neil thought Mongolia had the most unique culture in Asia!

Maria was on a walk to the store. It was dead winter and very cold. She tried her best to stay warm but it was freezing. It was so cold that she decided to go inside the nearest building. She waited there for a friend to pick her up.

When I was a sophomore in college, the Occupy movement arrived. In my town, college students were protesting with the homeless. I went, one night, to the protest site and met a boy. We left the protest together, spray painted bill boards, and drank. I learned that the protesters had no idea what they were doing.
As an adult, Matha was still afraid of doctor's appointments. She had a phobia of having blood drawn. She didn't like shots either. Doctor's intimidated her. She doesn't like going to the doctor.

Ronald dropped his toothbrush into the toilet. He promptly threw it away and searched underneath the sink. Viola,he found his old toothbrush. He began to brush his teeth, when suddenly his wife came in. She screamed and informed him that she used that to clean toilets.

Bryan loved to play in the woods. He always dreamed of building a treehouse. One day his dad said they could build one. Bryan and his dad worked very hard on the tree house. He played in it every day after school.

You should always be courteous when ending a relationship. For example, one of my exes and I ended on good terms and stayed close. He got an amazing job and hired me on. Now I'm on my ideal career path all because I wasn't a jerk. Now we have a great professional relationship.

Chuck looked in the kitchen cabinets for something to cook. He was bored by everything he saw. He quickly made up his mind what would be for dinner. He got in his car. Chuck drove to McDonald's for dinner.

Cathy has always wanted to have a child. She thought she was told old to conceive. Cathy talked to her doctor. He gave her confidence she could still have a baby. Last week Cathy found out she was pregnant.

Sasha decided she wanted to adopt a dog. She went to the humane society. She looked at lots of dogs and puppies. She played with a golden retriever puppy for two hours. She adopted it and took it home that night.

Bill had hunted game with his father as a youngster. His father died at age 89. Bill's sister and brother told Bill he could have the guns. He expected the deer rifle and the shotgun. He was surprised that there was also a gun from World War One.
Tom had a birthday party. He decided to drink too much. Tom got drunk right away and got into fights. He had people angry at him and then threw up. He passed and and woke up embarrassed.

I decided to eat oatmeal to lose weight and stay healthy. It tasted awful. I added sugar, cinnamon, butter, candy, marshmallows, and chocolate. The new ingredients made it taste amazing. However, I was shocked when I gained 15 pounds.

Pat was going to get a puppy from the pet store. The puppy she had her eye on was sold earlier in the day. The pet store owner brought out the puppy's brother. He was a runt that no one else had wanted. It was love at first sight for Pat.
Allie loved makeup. She went to the store try to some on. She painted a lot of foundation on. Allie looked in the mirror. She was shocked at how good she looked.

Kyle had a lingering flu. Finally his mom took him to the doctor. After a chest x-ray, the doctor said Kyle had pneumonia! He needed very strong medication. It was very lucky Kyle had seen the doctor for treatment in time!

Jack went to the bank to deposit a check. He waited in line for 10 minutes. When it was his turn, the teller called him up. He handed her the check and she deposited it into his account. She gave him a receipt and he left.

Wanda went to church every Sunday religiously. However, one day, her pastor started making rude comments. Wanda was so upset that she looked for another church. Finally, she found one that she wanted to visit. Wanda really enjoyed her new church and everyone was kind.

Brent loves to play football with his friends. He decided to try out for his high school football team. During tryouts, Brent ran faster than everyone on the team! Coach was impressed with Brent's speed and made him a wide receiver. Brent caught the winning pass in his first football game that night!

Scott lives life young and reckless. He goes to parties and takes drugs often. One night, he went to a party and did cocaine and heroin. This caused him to overdose. They sent him to the hospital but he died.

I got my driver's license back. I was able to pay someone else instead. A lady rejected my offer. I told her I would pay for part of her car damage. I had caused a wreck.
Gary's dog was a mess. He barked and drooled a lot. Gary came home and the dog jumped up on him. He had drool dripped from his face. Gary yelled and brushed the drool off of him.

Matt took a sick kitten he just found to the vet. They had to remove her eyes because they were badly infected. Matt offered to help her learn how to get around while blind. Slowly but surely she learned how to navigate through touch and sound. Eventually she could get around almost as well as a regular cat!

Tony planned to go to Italy that summer to see his father's family. Has he had never been there he made a lot of research. He took a few Italian lessons online. He bought his plane ticket. But when he was ready to leave his mom got sick and he had to cancel.
Kara found a stray kitten. She took it home and nursed him. Soon he grew stronger and sturdier. Before long he was a full-grown cat, healthy and happy! Kara was so glad she had rescued the stray.
Bob had a midlife crisis. He decided to climb Mount Everest. He conditioned and trained for the climb for three months. He reached the top of the mountain! On the way down, he slipped and died.
Tom wanted a new grill. His wife thought it was an unnecessary expense. But Tom wanted it very badly! Finally she gave in and let him buy it. Tom loved his new grill!

Nicole has been dealing with a sore back for a couple of weeks. She gave in and went to the doctor. The doctor ordered an MRI of the area. The MRI revealed a slipped disc. Nicole had to go to physical therapy to fix the problem.
Frank decided to get some gum. He went to the store. There was a giant gum display. He picked out a pack he liked. Frank paid for the gum.
Mom's vase sat on a shelf. As I was cleaning yesterday, I knocked it over. It was her favorite. I did not know what to do so I hid it. Mom found out and ground me for a month.

Jake was a very picky eater. He wouldn't eat any vegetables at all. One day his father cooked kabobs. His father didn't tell him there were vegetable on it. Jake loved the new meal even though there were veggies.
Bill had so much turkey for Thanksgiving. He was sick of it by December. So on Christmas day he decided to change it up. And got a ham instead for the first time. It was his best Christmas ever.
Jane decided she wanted to become a farmer. She got a job at a nearby farm. The work was difficult. However, Jane was happy to be a farmer. Jane was proud of her career choice.

Rachel went bowling with a couple of friends. When it was her turn to bowl, she realized her hands were sweaty. She was nervous because she had never been good at bowling. However, when she bowled, she knocked down every pin. Rachel ended up winning every game that night.

Allie was walking her dog yesterday. They were walking in the park. All the sudden a cute man walks by. Allie was intrigued. So she got the courage and asked for his number of which he gave.

My mom made me clean up my room yesterday. She said I couldn't go outside until I was finished. It took me all morning but I finally cleaned my room. She looked over my room and was happy with the work I did. I was finally able to go outside and play with my friends.
I always wanted to meet Michael Jordan. I traveled to Chicago. He was signing autographs for fans. I stood in line for five hours. I shook Michael Jordan's hand.

The bus ran into a gasoline truck. Both vehicles slid on the highway. Many cars had to come to a stop in order to avoid being hit. Police officials came and evacuated all of the children from the car. The fire extinguisher team quickly extinguished all of the flames.
Kelley had to make a speech. She was so nervous. She got up on stage and ended up messing up. Kelley was so embarrassed. She wanted to hide herself.

Jack and Jane brought their infant to the mall in December. The mall Santa was taking pictures with the attendees. The parents decided it would be cute to take a picture. When it was their turn, the baby ripped off the Santa's beard. Everyone had a good laugh.

Allison applied to three colleges, during her senior year. Every day, she went online to check the status of her applications. She also checked her mailbox when she got home from school. One day, she checked her email and saw a message from UNC. She opened the email and realized she had a college acceptance.

Sam was really hungry. He had forgotten to eat breakfast prior to work. He went to grab Chinese food during his lunch break. He was unable to place an order due to an outrageously long line. Sam had to eat chips from the vending machine instead.

My friend works in a government purchasing office. He was asked to issue an order for work already performed. At a seminar he was told this was illegal. His boss pushed him to issue the order. He called the press.

Joanne had spent all day searching for her phone. She'd left it down on the subway that morning. After retracing all her steps, she was still phoneless. She decided to buy a new one and went online. Just as she was about to order, she realized she'd lost her purse too.
I got a new phone yesterday. I was very excited and loved playing with it. However it fell out of my hands and shattered. I was bummed out. But thankfully it can be fixed.
Kevin loved to hunt. It was his favorite way to pass time. He had killed all types of animals. Kevin's living room was full of taxidermy. He was very proud of his hunting skills.

I wanted to save a little money at the store. I knew the kids wanted doritos. I saw a bag of doritos styled generic chips. They were only a dollar, so I bought them. The kids took one bite and I could tell they were disgusting.

Two cats were standing next to each other. They looked at a piece of meat on the ground. One cat went in to grab the meat. The other cat scratched the paw away. The two cats fought while a dog grabbed the meat and ran away!
My daughter was in the bathroom playing. Now my toilet won't flush. I tried using a plunger to no avail. I also tried some drain clog chemicals. Nothing worked, so now I have to call the plumber.

Steve wanted to go for a job but his shorts didn't have pockets. He had to wear his mother's purse to hold his phone and keys. A policeman saw Steve and thought he stole the purse. This caused Steve to run faster than he ever did before. Steve thought he was being tailed by the fashion police.
Greg really wanted an ice pop. He didn't have any. Greg stuck a spoon into a pudding pack. He placed that into the freezer for an hour. Now Greg has an ice pop.
Nala was unprepared for her Spanish test. She could not think of any of the answers. She just jotted down random nonsense. She ended up failing the test. Nala was disappointed, but not surprised.

Tom was a cook for an important restaurant and was proud to work there. One day while attending a family gathering he noticed something weird. His cousins was coughing and sneezing all over the place. He said it was fine but Tom ran home anyways, scared for his job. The next day Tom was fired for getting everyone sick.

Galvin was a big brother of an 8 year old girl. As a big brother he made sure to protect her from all bad things. He had found out his sister was getting bullied on the bus. He told his principal about the problem. The principal then punished the bully.
Jim loved to play pranks. He was determined to get his dad. He decided to put ketchup on the kitchen counter. His dad walked in and thought Jim had chopped off his finger. Jim finally got him.

Ed had recently lost his job. He knew he had to find something else quickly. The only job he could quickly find was to be a restaurant server. He hate it and was exhausted after each shift. He quit and decided being unemployed was better than that.

Anne woke up with a terrible headache. She had been up late the night before studying for a big test. Anne looked in her bathroom for some pain killers. When she couldn't find any, she asked her roommate for medicine. Anne's roommate gave her two tylenols to help with her headache.

I bought a new grill from the store downtown. The grill started off working great. The grill would not light the second time I tried to use it. I decided to bring the grill back to the store. The store gave me a refund for the broken grill.

Jamie was wandering through the woods. He picked up a stick and threw it against a tree. The tree screamed out and said ow. Jamie was very puzzled about the sound. Then someone in camouflage stepped out from behind the tree.

Ashley wants to switch careers. She's a teacher and she is sick of it. She is underpaid and overworked on a daily basis. She has applied to many jobs in other fields over the past week. She hopes to land some interviews soon.

Georgina was in a loveless marriage. She decided to have an affair with her coworker. Georgina then realized the co worker looked very similar to her husband. She told her husband she was cheating on him. He didn't mind because he saw her boyfriend looked like him.
I was at a picnic one day. Suddenly a bee stung me. My arm began to swell. A doctor said I was allergic to bees. I had not known that before.
Bobby got homework. Bobby didn't like homework. His parents made him do it. Bobby got the homework done really late. Bobby had to go to sleep as soon as he finished.

Kay decided to make pancakes for her family. She put all the ingredients together and got to work. Each pancake turned out light and fluffy and golden-brown. However, when she took a bite, she realized they tasted awful! She had put salt instead of sugar.

Larry had just got some very bad news. He was sick with cancer and it was stage 4. Larry decided he was going to start on his bucket list. Larry decided to jump out of an airplane. Larry felt so alive during his final hours.

I was wearing a scarf last weekend. It was cold and I figured it matched my outfit. Without noticing I got it caught on the taxi door. The car almost drove off and dragged me. I barely got the driver's attention in tim.

Krista had to finish her final paper by Wednesday afternoon. The problem was she also had dance practice that same day. She had to come up with some way to solve this dilemma. She brainstormed over many ways to handle it. Krista decided to finish the paper during dance practice break times.

Chucky was having a hard time landing a job. He just recently graduated college. He went to apply for a bank job. He was nervous but he got a call from the bank. Chucky interviewed and landed the job.
Fred was running late for school. He put on whatever shirt he could find. He went downstairs. Then he realized it was inside out. He had to change it.
Dan was a crooked businessman he often cheated innocent people One day one of his victims found out about Dan He called the FBI Dan was sent to jail

Paul maintained a small business's server room. He was puzzled why their machines would reboot every night. Finally he spent the night at work watching what happened. Paul saw the janitor come in and remove the power cables. He realized his mistake of not keeping the server room locked.

Today someone drove into my car while at an intersection. Luckily, I got the car's registration plate before they drove off. I called the cops and let them know what happened. Turns out it was my boyfriend's brother's girlfriend who did it. Now everyone I know is mad at me for getting her into trouble.

We boarded the military truck. We were handed a bunch of paint balls. We loaded them into our pretend guns. We rode through the forest, shooting men dressed as zombies. We laughed and enjoyed the ride.
Erik wanted a pet. His parents decided he could have a fish. He was so happy. He reached in the tank to pet his new friend. Then his parents made him flush it down the toilet, RIP.

Sara watched the sunrise as she told me she was expecting her first child. She and her husband wanted a big family. When she woke up in pain she thought it must be the flu. By the time the sun came up she knew she needed a doctor. The next sunrise never came for Sara or her baby.
Tom didn't have a toaster. He only had a toaster oven. He tried to make buttered toast. He didn't time it right. Tom wound up burning his toast.

Emily needed to fill out taxes for the first time. She had no idea how to fill everything out. She decided to consult her grandmother. Luckily, she was willing to help Emily through it. Emily's tax return went off without a single hitch.

Josiah ran after the opposing player with the ball. He slapped the ball from the boys hands too a teammate. His teammate dribbled towards their basket. Josiah took a pass from the teammate and made a basket as time expired The team hugged each other in celebration.

We went to an amusement park in 1992. My son was too small to ride a roller coaster. We found an old car sitting on the ground. We sat in it and raised our hands. My son posted the photo on FB 24 years later.
George took his niece to the bookstore. He let her choose one book. She picked out a Peppa Pig book. He then bought her a coloring book too. George and his niece had a fun outing.
Sara was a candidate for prom queen. At prom, she was hopeful. She really wanted to win! But when the winner was announced, it wasn't her. Sara was dismayed.

Betty was five Year's old and loved to go to restaurants. Every weekend she would beg her mother to take her out to eat. One weekend, her mother took her to a Mexican restaurant. Betty ordered something that was too spicy for her. For many weeks after, Betty did not ask to go out to eat.

Mark decided that he would travel across the country. He decided that he would begin walking in the morning. He ended up walking for 24 hours straight without stopping. He met a woman during his walk that admired his determination. After he made it across the country he married the woman he met.
Bart got a skateboard for Christmas. Bart tried to ride the skateboard. Bart fell off the skateboard. Bart was scared of the skateboard. Bart hid the skateboard in his closet.
Leah put on her summer dress. She twirled the dress around. The dress felt starchy. She washed the dress with socks. The dress felt better after that.

Ann had to help her brother with boxes. He wanted them lifted into the house. Ann agreed to help but had no idea how heavy they would be. They ended up being fifty pounds. Ann nearly passed out when she was done.

Maurice has just moved into a new city and he needs a job. His friend recommends he try shining shoes at first. It is a very difficult job, and it does not pay a lot of money. However, Maurice works many hours to survive. He feels proud to have a job in his new city.

Jack joined the summer swim team. He was new to competitive swimming. His teammates won more races than he did. Still, he showed up and tried his best. To his surprise, he was named Most Valuable Player!

The man signed up for a new cell phone plan. He got a new phone with the plan. He was not happy with the service. He cancelled the service early. He had to pay the full retail price of the phone as a penalty.

I hate spiders. Every time I see a spider I jump. One day while I was putting my shoes on I jumped. There was a spider in my shoe and it almost bit me. Now I never take my shoes off because I don't want to get bit.
Sarah wanted to learn how to draw flowers. First, she studied the way flowers were put together. Then she got her crayons. She got paper. And she drew the flower!

It was job review day at Bob's work. He sat down with his boss, who handed him a description of his job. It was a description Bob had never seen before. Bob's boss told him he was doing his job incorrectly. Bob argued, but ultimately received a bad review.

Brandon was seven years old and needed to see a dentist. He had a cavity. Brandon thought the procedure would hurt but not a lot of pain. He discovered the pain was unbearable. When he ran out of medicine, he moaned and groaned in pain.

Jill's mother was in the hospital. She had a minor operation done. Jill stayed in the hospital with her mother until she was released. Jill's mother was finally released. Jill continued visiting her mother everyday until she was fine.
I put my dog in training school. He is learning a lot of new tricks. He can now sit and stand. They are very good teachers. He will be finished in 3 weeks.
Simon got drunk and passed out. Everyone was worried about him. They decided to send for the hospital. He woke up hours later. He was fine.

John is only three years old. His mom and dad give him tons of hugs and kisses every day. Yesterday, John's mom told him he is going to be a big brother. He helped his parents pick out new toys for his brother or sister. John is very excited to meet his new brother or sister.

Joe was making breakfast. He was cooking scrambled eggs over the stove. When they were done he assembled them on a plate. He bit into the eggs. He spit them out because he forgot to put salt and pepper on them.

Rob was grounded for a week. He wasn't allowed to leave his room. His parents went out to dinner one night. Alex went to the living room and played Nintendo for hours. When he saw their headlights he ran to his room and feigned sleep.

Julie arrives early to the airport for her flight. Just as she gets to the desk, she receives an alert on her phone. Her airport check in app says her flight to Paris is canceled. Julie is sad, but has always wanted to visit Spain. She books a train to Barcelona instead.

When Anna was a small child, a bee stung her arm. She had to get medical treatment for the hives she immediately got! She feared bee stings for the next 20 years, until another stung her. Nothing happened at all - no swelling, no hives. Anna was relieved to find she'd outgrown her allergy!

I recently ordered a steam mop online. I was more excited than I should be to get a cleaning implement. When it arrived however it had clearly been previously used. It was supposed to be a new item so I sent it back right away. I did finally get a refund but I still feel so annoyed!

Cathy had to find a way to register to vote. Cathy would be a first time voter in this election. Cathy researched and found a way to register to vote. After registering, Cathy was issued a voter's card. Cathy was proud that she registered to vote for the first time.

I was by my grandmother's side when she passed. She was sleeping quietly in the hospital. We were all sitting around her talking. I looked at her and realized she wasn't breathing. Her monitor flatlined soon after.
Floyd owned a funeral home. He bought a shiny new hearse. He used it at the next funeral he did. The family really loved the sleek new car. Floyd knew it had been a wise purchase.

Tim's home alarm kept going off at night. Any minor movement would set it off. Tim tried to change it but it didn't work. He had to call the alarm company to fix it. They replaced it with something similar.

Sara went to her parent's funeral on Sunday. It was a sunny day but no one else was present. That left Sara feel very alone in a world that was still happy. She went back home afterward to cry. And when she had no more tears, she looked at old photographs.

Harry was running low on cash. He had rent due at the end of the week. His friend Oscar had a decent amount of money saved. He knew Harry's stress and offered to loan Harry money. Harry had a rule about accepting money from friends but had no choice.
Josh wanted to surprise his sister. He knew she wanted a puppy. He went to the shelter and adopted one. He gave it to her for her birthday. She absolutely loved the puppy.

Amy loved summer but hated summer events. A friend at work invited her to a party in the park. She agreed to go but really wasn't looking forward to it. They day of the party she dressed and went to the park. Amy stayed just long enough to make an appearance and hurried home.

When i was in college i was too worried about my weight. During vacant time all i do is eating . Until i get fat and gain  weight. I tried all vitamins that could make me slim and lost weight. But nothing has changed,i'm still fat and loves to eat.
Tom didn't have a lot of pants. He decided to buy a new pair. He went to different stores. Tom tried various pairs. He never found any he liked that much.
The talent show was going on for a long time. The second to last act left the stage. The last act was up. They did the best. Their group won at the end.

Amy's mother took her to the library. She wanted to find books by Beverly Cleary. She was elated to see they carried all of her books. She wanted to check the all out. Her mother made her narrow it down to 3 books.

Fran was gearing up for the surprise. She had made her dad a birthday cake. It was her father's birthday and he would be home soon. She pulled the cake out of the oven and decorated it. Her father walked in and was so happy and surprised.
A month ago I learned to knit. It was very fun for me. I am very thankful I learned how. Now I am able to make my own sweaters. I am thankful my mom taught me.

Donna had woken up and gone for a jog early in the morning. When she got home, her husband had laid out a large breakfast for her. She began to eat, waiting for her husband so she could thank him. Her husband finally appeared, with presents and a bouquet of flowers. It was then Donna remembered today was her birthday.

Dil's theatre troupe was performing Shakespeare plays outdoors. The troupe kept casting him in minor roles. One day, they finally cast him in a medium-sized role. It was the role of Mercutio in Romeo and Juliet. Dil acted it so well that his stature in the troupe grew.

Mary's favorite holiday is Halloween. Every year, she makes her costume and enters into a costume contest. This year, she decided to make a Betty Boop costume. It took her two weeks to get her costume put together just right. Mary's Betty Boop costume won first place in the costume contest.

Jane wanted to do something special for her mother's birthday. She ordered a brand new set of cast iron cookware on Amazon. Jane placed the order with Amazon prime. On the day of her mother's birthday, Jane's present didn't arrive. Jane was able to get a partial refund for late shipping.

A little girl was very excited to go back to school. The girl loved to read. She couldn't wait to meet new friends and have her own desk. Her mom took her school clothes shopping. The little girl picked out many outfits and a new pair of shoes.

A chemist was in the lab while a nasty storm was outside. The lights when out and he had no back up lights. The chemist felt his way to the door. He stumbled into a shelf a jar fell over on him. The chemist was covered in an unknown white powder.
George wanted to become President. He collected campaign donations. He talked to all the important people. He bought ad in the newspapers and on TV. But he didn't even make it to the primaries.

Lou has a large dog named Boo Boo. He decided to take BooBoo to a dog park. BooBoo was very frightened of the other dogs. Lou decided to take BooBoo home before anything bad happened. BooBoo stays at home now.
Susie went to the local pool. To her delight there was a water slide. Susie was thrilled. She went on it as she pleased. But she was yelled at because she did not alert the lifeguard.
My friends invited me rollerblading. I said okay. When I got there I started tripping and falling. It was hard to balance. Finally I got the hang of it.
Nate was driving with his girlfriend. She spotted a stray cat on the side of the road. She immediately pulled over. Nate tried to convince her to just leave it. Instead they now have a new pet cat.

Molly was nervous about borrowing her friend's car. She drove extra careful to ensure the car was safe. Yet, she found a scratch on the car after going in a store. Horrified, she brought the car to the shop to have the scratch fixed. Molly's friend was confused to find the old scratch gone.
Yesterday I threw my jeans in the wash. When I took them out I was upset. I realized I left my phone in there. I was rather upset. I had to buy a new one.

The sneakers we wear are made in a factory far away. Workers measure and cut the materials for the sneakers there. They sew and glue together the pieces to make them into sneakers. Every day, thousands of new sneakers go into boxes to be shipped. After a long boat trip, the sneakers arrive for us to buy.

Aaron was an actor in a play. During rehearsal, he forgot one of his lines. He looked up at the stage director with worry. The director gave him a frustrated look. Aaron felt ashamed that he hadn't studied his lines very well.
Susy wanted to go to this rock concert. When she got there she waited patiently. Then she and her friend found out it was canceled. The musician was sick. Susy was very upset about it.
Ben had a new kite. Sam had a new kite as well. Sam's kite flew and Ben's didn't. Sam felt bad. Sam gave his kite to Ben and they were both happy.

Jose once heard about underwater wicker basket weaving. People told him it was a ridiculous career. Naturally Jose chose to do it anyways. He learned to scuba, and how to weave the best baskets. And now one of the biggest youtube videos is him making a basket.
I watched my snake try to eat a fish. First she grabbed it out of the tank. But it squirmed away and went on the gravel. She slithered back out of the fish tank. Grabbed the sucker and devoured him.

Jean had never been very good at math. She had to take an acoustical physics class for her degree. Her friend knew a physics professor who offered to tutor her. She struggled all semester long to understand the concepts. Eventually she passed, but still doesn't consider herself good at math.
Tom was walking home from the grocery store. He was approaching his house. He heard a small cat making a sound. He approached the cat. He pet the kitten.

Amy was swimming in the pond with her friends. When she got out for lunch, she saw something odd. There was a thick black slug-like thing on her leg! Amy panicked and slapped at the leech spastically. It fell off, leaving a trail of blood down her leg!

David hadn't felt healthy for a few days. He tried to go to school in order to pass his math class. While he was taking his test he began coughing and felt very sick. The nurse of the school ended up coming to check on him. He was told he could take a makeup test and to go home for the week.

Tom was getting fast food. When they called his order he noticed it was wrong. Tom noticed someone else got his food instead. He asked them if they would like to swap. They agreed and things were resolved.

In summer of 1992 I learned how to make free money. My friend showed me to put a blank envelope in an atm machine. Next, enter the deposit amount of $400. Now withdraw $400. I did as demonstrated but owe BofA $400 to this very day.

My nephew had a bad back one day. His mom had some prescription painkillers She lived on the tenth floor of a high rise. She dropped the pills out the window but they fell onto the ground. My nephew was angry as the pills were pulverized.
Jim has a Spanish test tomorrow. He has not studied at all. Jim decided to play hooky from school. However, his mom caught him. Not only did he get grounded but he also got detention.

I came to school mad since I barely got sleep last night. My friend greeted me and I gave her a mean look. The next day, she began to ignore me. However, I told her what happened during the day I was mad. She understood because she thought that I was mad at her.
A student ran around the classroom. He yelled at the other students. The teacher spoke to him calmly. He began to calm down. The student learned a lot.

The Clarke family was having a new baby girl in late October. They asked their three oldest kids to pick out name for the new baby. All three selected the name Winnie Elaine Clarke. When the new baby finally arrived the children were excited. The entire family would later only call her by the nickname Win.

My dad has never been able to see well. He really needed new glasses but we couldn't afford them. After I got my paycheck one week I took him to an eye doctor! I decided it was time for him to get new glasses. After the doctor we went and got his new glasses, that I paid for.

Maya was hosting her very first Thanksgiving dinner. She tried her best to entertain while cooking dinner. As she chatted with guests she ran back and forth to the oven. Suddenly she got caught up in a chat with friends. Before it was too late, the turkey burned in the oven.

Seth was working at a store late one night. Suddenly some kids came in threatening him with a knife. He pretended to grab them some money, but grabbed a gun. When they saw the weapon, he could see them become terrified. They all ran quickly from the building.

Steve and Cheryl were newly newlyweds. They wanted to add to their family, but weren't quite ready for kids. One day on her way to work, Cheryl found a cat on the road. It was sick, but they nursed it back to health. The cat has been a member of their family ever since.

John was driving when he got a text. He decided to try and answer. He took his eyes off the road for a second and hit the car in front. Luckily it wasn't a bad accident. John apologized profusely and exchanged insurance information.

Jen was lying on the floor in the living room, ready to watch TV. She was eating a sandwich and spilled crumbs all around. Her mom told her she needed to clean them and her dirty plates up. Jen whined, but her mom wouldn't let her watch TV until she did it. Jen cleaned up her mess so she could go back to watching her show.

Tom lives in Chicago and he gets very cold winters. Today his car wouldn't start because it was so cold outside. He had to call into work and say he can't come in. Now he isn't going to get paid today. Tom wants to move somewhere warmer.

Jimmy loved bowling because his dad would take him. Over the course of a few years he is now a very good bowler. He is on the school team and at practice when it happened. He was bowling really well and ended up getting a 300. Jimmy and his dad were so happy!
